0.title: What is the passwordless sign-in tech that Google, Apple & Microsoft teamed up for?
0.article_body: Google, Microsoft and Apple on May 5 announced they are teaming up to expand support for a common passwordless sign-in standard created by the FIDO Alliance and the World Wide Web Consortium. Through the new system, sign-ins will be possible through the same actions that users take to unlock their devices, like fingerprint or face verification or a device PIN.

1.title: Leaves of Kolkata civic body staff being cancelled amid Cyclone Asani alert
1.article_body: The Kolkata Municipal Corporation (KMC) has put its employees and disaster management teams on alert in view of the formation of cyclonic storm Asani, which is likely to intensify further, Mayor Firhad Hakim said. Leaves of all employees are being cancelled to deal with any emergency evolving due to the cyclone, which is unlikely to hit the city, Hakim added.

2.title: Discussing baby names with Deepika, don't want others to steal them: Ranveer
2.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has revealed that he has a list of baby names and is discussing them with his wife actress Deepika Padukone. He further said that he is fascinated by unique names but is very secretive about the list because he doesn't "want people to steal" the names. "I don't want them to get common," the actor added.

3.title: Irrfan in 'Piku' car scene was "brilliance beyond words": Big B
3.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan has stated that late actor Irrfan Khan's performance in a scene in 2015 film 'Piku' was "brilliance beyond words". Irrfan's character was about to drive Deepika Padukone and her family to Kolkata. Amitabh stated that Irrfan gave a look to Deepika's character in the scene and "conveyed an entire paragraph of dialogues" in "those magical few seconds".

4.title: Class 8 Punjab boy sodomised by 3 men for a year; accused arrested
4.article_body: Three men, including two brothers, were arrested for allegedly sodomising a Class 8 boy in Punjab for a year. The 16-year-old boy's father claimed his son had been depressed for past few days. He narrated his ordeal when his father asked him about it. "The trio had also threatened him of dire consequences if he told anybody," his father added.

5.title: Sidhu to meet Punjab CM Mann tomorrow to discuss state's economy
5.article_body: Former Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu will meet Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann in Chandigarh on Monday. In a tweet, Sidhu said he will discuss with the CM matters regarding the revival of Punjab's economy. "Punjab's resurrection is only possible with an honest collective effort," Sidhu added.

6.title: 60-year-old dies after police assaults her in UP, alleges family
6.article_body: A 60-year-old woman died after being assaulted by the police in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad, her family alleged on Sunday. The victim, Radha Devi, was "violently shaken" by a policeman, following which she collapsed and died. Additional SP (City) Mukesh Chandra Mishra said a police team had reached Devi's house on Saturday evening to check on her four jailed sons.

7.title: Pushp Kumar Joshi takes over as HPCL Chairman & MD
7.article_body: Pushp Kumar Joshi on Sunday took over as the new Chairman and Managing Director of Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL), India's third-largest oil refining and fuel marketing company. Prior to this, Joshi was the Director-HR of the state-owned firm. He has replaced Mukesh Kumar Surana, who was superannuated from services on April 30, 2022.

8.title: RCB hand SRH their 4th straight defeat in IPL 2022, get to 14 points
8.article_body: RCB on Sunday handed SRH their fourth straight defeat in IPL 2022. RCB have now won two matches in a row and are currently fourth on the points table with 14 points. Faf du Plessis top-scored for RCB with 73*(50), while RCB leg-spinner Wanindu Hasaranga took five wickets. RCB will next face PBKS on Friday.

9.title: Gangster from Middle East offered ₹1.25cr owed by producers: Amjad Khan's son
9.article_body: Late veteran actor Amjad Khan's son Shadaab has revealed that a gangster from Middle East offered to give them ₹1.25 crore owed by producers after his death. He added that his mother refused, saying her husband never took favours from the underworld. "My father had a habit of helping people and letting go of a lot of money," Shadaab added.

10.title: Shanghai tightens lockdown to attain 'zero-COVID' goal by late May: Report
10.article_body: Shanghai is tightening its COVID-19 lockdown restrictions in a bid to curb the spread of the virus, Reuters has reported. Curbs will likely vary across the city's 16 districts but movement restrictions will reportedly remain in place till late May to attain the 'zero-COVID' goal. Shanghai reported over 3,760 local asymptomatic COVID-19 cases on Sunday.

11.title: Indian men's team beat Germany 5-0 in their opener at Thomas and Uber Cup
11.article_body: Indian men's badminton team beat Germany 5-0 in their Group C opener at Thomas and Uber Cup Finals in Bangkok on Sunday. World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen, Kidambi Srikanth, HS Prannoy won their respective singles matches, while doubles pairs of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy-Chirag Shetty and MR Arjun-Dhruv Kapila emerged victorious in doubles matches. India will face Canada on Monday.

12.title: DC to bowl first against CSK, injured Ravindra Jadeja replaced by Shivam Dube
12.article_body: DC captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. DC have made two changes to their playing XI, with KS Bharat and Axar Patel replacing Mandeep Singh and Lalit Yadav. Meanwhile, Shivam Dube has replaced injured Ravindra Jadeja in CSK's playing XI.

13.title: Jet Airways granted security clearance by Home Ministry
13.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has granted security clearance to Jet Airways which is planning to relaunch commercial flight operations in the next few months, PTI reported citing an official document. The Jalan-Kalrock Consortium-led airline operated a test flight in Hyderabad last Thursday. It will now conduct proving flights, following which the DGCA will grant it the air operator certificate.

14.title: Bike rally held to raise awareness about soil conservation in Mumbai
14.article_body: About 200 people took part in a bike rally on Sunday in Mumbai to raise awareness about soil conservation. "Throughout history, motorcycling communities have rallied for great causes. Mumbai's motorcycle community has come out...to amplify the message to Save our Soil," the chief ride organiser said. The rally was organised as part of 'Save Soil' campaign launched by Sadhguru.

15.title: 20-yr-old student robbed of bike worth ₹60,000 by 4 men in Pune
15.article_body: A 20-year-old student was robbed of his bike worth ₹60,000 by four men in Pune district's Chinchwad area, police said. The man was with his friend near a school when the incident took place. The accused allegedly beat them up with bamboo and kicked them before snatching the keys to the bike.

16.title: Took a bit of time to move on: MI pacer Sams on his 35-run over vs KKR
16.article_body: Reflecting upon his 35-run over in MI's five-wicket loss against KKR in IPL 2022, MI pacer Daniel Sams said, "It took a bit of time to move on from that and see what I can learn." Against GT on Friday, Sams defended nine runs in final over of the match to help MI register their second win this season.

17.title: 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' one of greatest movies ever: Sam Raimi
17.article_body: Filmmaker Sam Raimi, who directed the Tobey Maguire-starrer 'Spider-Man' trilogy, has called Tom Holland's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' "one of the greatest movies" he has ever seen. He further said that he admires the film's director Jon Watts, adding that watching it was an emotional experience. Sam also said he "laughed his head off" when he heard the film's plot.

18.title: Delhi-NCR schools revising timings, restricting outdoor activities amid heatwave
18.article_body: Schools in Delhi-NCR are revising school timings, restricting outdoor activities, stocking ORS and glucose sachets and motivating students to remain hydrated due to severe heatwave conditions. Earlier this week, parents of students had urged the Delhi government to either revise the school timings or advance the summer holidays. The IMD said Delhi may experience heatwave conditions from May 10-12.

19.title: Bommai got Karnataka CM post in exchange for money: Siddaramaiah
19.article_body: Leader of Opposition in Karnataka Assembly and Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Sunday said Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai got the Chief Minister's post in exchange for money. "RSS has made him Chief Minister, following their instructions is enough for him," he said. "Basavaraj Bommai is not an elected Chief Minister, he is an appointed Chief Minister," Siddaramaiah added.

20.title: Retd Delhi officer who raped minor changed appearance to evade arrest
20.article_body: Delhi Police arrested a retired Assistant Central Intelligence Officer (ACIO- Grade II) for allegedly raping his friend's minor daughter and informed that the accused changed his appearance to evade arrest. In the guise of getting the victim a job, the accused took her to a hotel in Karol Bagh, where he allegedly intimidated the minor and raped her.

21.title: UK announces additional 1.3 bn pounds in military aid to Ukraine
21.article_body: The UK has pledged an additional 1.3 billion pounds in military support and aid to Ukraine, as the British government emerges as one of the strongest supporter of the Ukrainian resistance. The extra funding will come from a reserve used by the UK for emergencies. The UK has already provided anti-tank missiles, air defence systems and other weapons to Ukraine.

22.title: Loans worth ₹5,000cr approved for women, SC/ST entrepreneurs in FY22
22.article_body: More than 23,000 loans, worth around ₹5,000 crore, were sanctioned during FY22 to women and SC/ST entrepreneurs under the government's Stand-Up India scheme, government data showed. As of March 31, 2022, a total of 1.35 lakh applications amounting to around ₹30,200 crore were sanctioned. The scheme was launched in April 2016.

23.title: Pune Police chief to hold Q&A session on Twitter tomorrow
23.article_body: Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta will hold a live question and answer (Q&A) session on Twitter on May 9 (Monday), the city police said. It asked people to feel free to post their questions using the hashtag LiveWithCPPuneCity. "Look forward to chatting with as many of you as possible! Questions, inputs, and feedback...all welcome," the Commissioner said.

24.title: Got ₹45 lakh bill for plane hired for Punjab CM Mann's 3-day Guj visit: State govt
24.article_body: Punjab government got a ₹44,85,967 lakh bill for a plane hired for CM Bhagwant Mann's three-day visit to Gujarat in April, the state's Department of Civil Aviation has said in response to an RTI query. CM Mann visited Gujarat from April 1 to 3 with AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal. They attended the virtual launch of the party's poll campaign.

25.title: User accuses IndiGo of denying boarding to differently-abled child; Airline replies
25.article_body: A Twitter user shared a detailed account of how a differently-abled child was denied from boarding an IndiGo flight at the Ranchi airport. The user alleged that the airline said the passenger would be a risk to others and "needed to quiet down to become travel-worthy". Meanwhile, the airline tweeted that the team was looking into the matter.

26.title: 50-yr-old Nigerian man's naked body found in toilet in Palghar; 6 held
26.article_body: A 50-year-old Nigerian national's naked body was found in a toilet of a building in Palghar's Vasai, police have confirmed. According to police, six Nigerians had killed the victim a few days back, who were traced and consequently arrested from Guwahati. Police suspect that a failed financial transaction over drugs could be the motive of the crime.

27.title: Tesla accuses ex-engineer of returning dummy laptop after stealing data secrets
27.article_body: Tesla has sued former engineer, Alexander Yatskov, for allegedly transferring confidential information on its supercomputer technology to his personal devices and turning over a "dummy" laptop to cover up theft. Yatskov quit in May and has refused to return the stolen data, claimed Tesla. The company also accused him of lying on his resume about his expertise and work experience.

28.title: Pune's Sassoon Hospital's NICU saves 12,000 infants in 5 years
28.article_body: Pune's Sassoon General Hospital's NICU (neonatal intensive care unit) has saved over 12,000 infants by providing treatment free of charge in the last five years. "Nothing can match the joy of rebirth of an infant on the face of the mother. It works as the driving force for us," said Dr Vinayak Kale, Dean, Sassoon General Hospital.

29.title: Bengaluru likely to witness rain or thundershowers in next 24 hours
29.article_body: Bengaluru is very likely to see rain or thundershowers in the next 24 hours, the India Meteorological Department said on Sunday. The city is expected to have a cloudy sky and the maximum temperature is likely to settle around 33°C. The IMD has forecast that surface winds are likely to be strong and gusty at times.

30.title: Looking at everyone's photos, I miss you more: Akshay on Mother's Day
30.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar on Sunday took to social media to share a picture with his late mother Aruna Bhatia to mark Mother's Day. He wrote in Hindi, "Not a day goes by when I don't think about you, but looking at everyone's Mother's Day photos makes me miss you even more." Akshay's mother passed away on September 8, 2021.

31.title: I reckon MS Dhoni will play another IPL season: Shoaib Akhtar
31.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said that CSK skipper MS Dhoni might play another IPL season before quitting. "Can't really predict what Dhoni does...I reckon he will play another season before he calls it a day," Akhtar said. "Or again, he might be part of the management," he added. The 40-year-old has scored 142 runs in 10 matches so far.

32.title: 60-year-old sets himself ablaze to stop eviction drive in Chennai
32.article_body: A 60-year-old street vendor in Chennai attempted self-immolation on Sunday to protest against Tamil Nadu government's encroachment eviction drive. Residents are resisting the water department's eviction drive, which has been going on for the last 10 days, while seeking time to move the Supreme Court over their eviction. The man suffered severe burn injuries and is critical, police said.

33.title: 70-yr-old Mumbai man molests 10-yr-old neighbour after luring her with chocolates
33.article_body: A 70-year-old man has been arrested in Mumbai for allegedly molesting his 10-year-old neighbour by inviting her to his place to play frequently by luring her with chocolates and biscuits. The incident came to light after the minor girl started behaving strangely when her mother probed her. Police claimed the accused would remove her clothes and touch her private parts.

34.title: Sri Lankan Opposition rejects Prez's offer to form interim govt
34.article_body: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), Sri Lanka's main opposition party, on Sunday said that it has rejected an offer by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to form an interim government. Notably, President Rajapaksa has refused to quit office despite mounting pressure from protesters amid a severe economic crisis in the country. Rajapaksa has imposed a state of emergency in response to the protests.

35.title: B'luru residents complain of foul smell from sewage treatment plant
35.article_body: Residents of the Lingadheeranahalli area in Bengaluru have complained of foul smell emanating from a sewage treatment plant. The plant had been shut for five years before the Supreme Court overturned the National Green Tribunal's stay orders. Karnataka State Pollution Control Board chairman Shanth A Thimmaiah said he will visit the plant and look into the issue.

36.title: Virat Kohli bows down to Dinesh Karthik after his 375-strike rate knock, video goes viral
36.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli bowed down to his teammate Dinesh Karthik in the dressing room after the latter scored an unbeaten 30 runs off eight deliveries at a strike rate of 375 against SRH. Karthik's eight-ball knock included four sixes and a four. It helped RCB put up a total of 192/3. Karthik has scored 274 runs in IPL 2022.

37.title: News anchor Aman Chopra escaped arrest after UP Police made us wait: Raj Police
37.article_body: Rajasthan Police has alleged that UP Police didn't cooperate with its team that went to arrest news anchor Aman Chopra from his Noida home. "Our team was made to wait at the Noida police station and the accused had slipped away by then," said Dungarpur SP Sudhir Joshi. Chopra's house was found locked by the police team.

38.title: Roller coaster gets stuck mid-ride, riders left hanging upside down for 45 mins in US
38.article_body: A roller coaster ride at an amusement park in the US stopped and the riders were left hanging upside down for nearly 45 minutes due to a technical glitch. The amusement park later released a statement about this and said all riders were safely evacuated. The Flying Cobras ride sends riders through a 360-degree loop, flipping them six times.

39.title: Djokovic, because he's no. 1: Alcaraz on world's best tennis player
39.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz was asked to choose between Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal to name his pick as the world's best tennis player. To this, Alcaraz replied, "Djokovic, because he's No. 1. But I don't know what to say. Both of them are some of the best players of history." This comes after Alcaraz defeated Djokovic in the Madrid Open semi-finals.

40.title: Shoot me if Cong wins a single seat in J&K polls: Ex-Cong MLA
40.article_body: Ex-J&K MLA Mohammad Amin Bhat has asked people to "shoot" him at Srinagar's Lal Chowk if Congress bags a single seat in the union territory's Assembly elections. Bhat, who has been demanding that Ghulam Nabi Azad be declared Congress' CM candidate, stated party is "zero" without Azad. Notably, his comments come days after the delimitation process of J&K was finalised.

41.title: Future Enterprises to raise ₹3,000 cr from insurance arm sale: Report
41.article_body: Debt-ridden Future Enterprises is planning to raise ₹3,000 crore by selling its insurance business to pare debts and avoid going into insolvency, reports said. FEL will reportedly sell its remaining 25% stake in Future Generali India Insurance (FGIICL) for ₹1,250 crore. It may also sell its 33.3% stake in Life Insurance JV-Future Generali India Life Insurance (FGILICL) for ₹400 crore.

42.title: What Yuvraj, Kaif did was extraordinary: Nick on NatWest series final
42.article_body: Recalling the 2002 NatWest series final against India, ex-England cricketer Nick Knight said the team didn't know much about Yuvraj Singh and Mohammad Kaif at that point. Nick said his side did not expect Team India to chase a total of 325 runs after Sachin Tendulkar's dismissal. "For those two guys to do what they did was extraordinary," he added.

43.title: Exciting to see another Spanish teenager work his way up: Kim on Alcaraz
43.article_body: Ex-world number one Kim Clijsters took to Twitter to praise 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz after he became the first-ever player to defeat Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic back-to-back at same clay-court tournament at Madrid Open. "So exciting to see another Spanish teenager work his way up in our sport. Takes me back to 2004-05 when Rafa started his journey," she wrote.

44.title: Tamil Nadu girl donates piggy bank saving of ₹4,400 to Sri Lanka
44.article_body: A girl from the Ramanathapuram district in Tamil Nadu donated ₹4,400, she saved in her piggy bank, to Sri Lanka, which is facing its worst economic crisis. The Indian high commission in Colombo praised the girl. Sharing pictures of her, it tweeted, "Strength of bond between the people of India and Sri Lanka on display!!!!"

45.title: Petition in HC to open 20 rooms in Taj Mahal to verify presence of Hindu idols
45.article_body: A petition has been filed in Allahabad High Court's Lucknow bench seeking directives to the Archaeological Survey of India to open 20 rooms inside Agra's Taj Mahal to ascertain the presence of Hindu deities' idols. The plea cited claims by some historians and Hindu groups about the monument being an old Shiva temple. BJP's Rajneesh Singh has filed the petition.

46.title: Anil Agarwal sings bhajan with his mother on video call on Mother's Day
46.article_body: The daughter of billionaire Anil Agarwal took to Twitter to share a video of the Executive Chairman of Vedanta Resources singing a bhajan with his mother on the occasion of Mother's Day. "From feeding my belly with the most delicious ghee shakkar rotis, to helping me succeed in my goals...I owe it all to you, Maaji," Agarwal tweeted in reply.

47.title: Unable to get ‘kick’, MP man complains of liquor adulteration
47.article_body: A 42-year-old man from MP has complained to authorities about a shop allegedly selling adulterated liquor as he did not get a "kick" after consuming it. The complainant said that he's been consuming liquor for the last two decades and is aware of its quality and taste. Following his complaint, the Excise Commissioner has ordered a probe into the matter.

48.title: Prithvi Shaw hospitalised after fever, shares pic from hospital bed
48.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) opener Prithvi Shaw took to Instagram to share that he has been hospitalised. Sharing a picture from the hospital bed, Shaw wrote, "Admitted in hospital and recovering from fever. Thank you all for your good wishes. Will be back in action soon." Shaw had missed DC's previous match and won't feature against CSK tonight as well.

49.title: Heatwave conditions likely in 6 states in next few days, IMD releases list
49.article_body: IMD has said that heatwave conditions will prevail in some areas over Rajasthan from May 8 to 12. Heatwave conditions will also be experienced in north Madhya Maharashtra on May 8 and 9 and in Vidarbha and west Madhya Pradesh from May 9 to 12. They're also predicted in south Haryana-Delhi and south Punjab from May 10 to May 12.

50.title: He's impressed me the most: Sehwag on PBKS wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh
50.article_body: Praising Jitesh Sharma in ongoing IPL, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said the PBKS wicketkeeper-batter has impressed him more than wicketkeeper-batters Rishabh Pant, Ishan Kishan and Wriddhiman Saha. Sehwag added that he's wondering if Jitesh could be in contention for a spot in India's squad for 2022 T20 World Cup. Jitesh scored an 18-ball 38* in last game against RR.

51.title: PWD to hire anti-smog guns, sprinklers to control air pollution
51.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department is planning to hire five to six anti-smog guns and truck-mounted water sprinklers to control air pollution in the city. The anti-smog guns will have a capacity to store 7,000 to 10,000 litres of water. The anti-smog guns spray nebulised water droplets in the air through high-pressure propellers, causing dust particles to settle down, reports said.

52.title: FPI ownership in equities falls to 19.5%, lowest since March 2019
52.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors' (FPIs) ownership in domestic equities of NSE500 companies fell to 19.5% in March 2022, according to Bank of America Securities India. This is its lowest level of FPI ownership since March 2019, when it was at 19.3%. FPI ownership was at its peak at 21.4% in December 2021. FPI ownership in March 2022 stood at $619 billion.

53.title: Ashok Gehlot has lost his mental balance: BJP MP Ram Kumar Verma
53.article_body: BJP's Rajya Sabha MP Ram Kumar Verma has claimed that Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has lost his "mental balance". "The way CM Gehlot speaks, it looks like he has lost his mental balance," Verma said. "It is clear now that those who are accusing the BJP-RSS are themselves responsible for the prevailing situation in the state," he added.

54.title: Indian Army rescues 2 youths stuck atop JCB in the middle of Chenab river in J&K
54.article_body: The Indian Army carried out a rescue operation and saved the lives two youths, who were trapped in the middle of the fast-flowing Chenab river in Jammu and Kashmir's  Kishtwar. The duo got stuck in the river current while attempting to cross it in their JCB earth mover. In a video footage, soldiers were purportedly seen rappelling across the river.

55.title: 'The Day After Tomorrow' actor Kenneth Welsh passes away at 80
55.article_body: Canadian actor Kenneth Welsh, best known for his roles in 'Fantastic 4: Rise of the Silver Surfer', 'The Day After Tomorrow' and 'The Aviator', has passed away at the age of 80. While the cause of death hasn't been revealed, his agent Pam Winter said that he died peacefully on May 5 at his home, surrounded by loved ones.

56.title: Evil has returned to Ukraine: Zelenskyy on World War II anniversary
56.article_body: During an address to mark a World War II anniversary on Sunday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that evil has returned to Ukraine. "In a different form, under different slogans, but for the same purpose," he added. On May 8, Europe commemorates the formal surrender of Germany to the Allies in World War II.

57.title: 4 killed after car hits motorbike in Tamil Nadu's Rameswaram
57.article_body: Four people were killed after a speeding car collided with a motorbike in Tamil Nadu’s Rameswaram district. In the incident, which occurred at 5:30 am on Sunday, all three men on the bike died while the car passengers did not sustain any serious injury, police said. Notably, a pedestrian on the highway also died in the accident.

58.title: Saudi King Salman hospitalised in Jeddah for medical tests
58.article_body: Saudi Arabia's King Salman bin Abdulaziz was admitted to a hospital in Jeddah to undergo medical tests, local media reported on Sunday. The 86-year-old monarch underwent gallbladder surgery in 2020 and reportedly had the battery of his heart pacemaker replaced in March of this year. Abdulaziz took over as Saudi Arabia's King in 2015.

59.title: Ranbir's baraat went from 5th to 7th floor, we danced in the passage: Neetu
59.article_body: Neetu Kapoor in a recent interview spoke about Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, which took place at the Vastu building in Mumbai. "The best part was baraat, which went from 5th to...7th floor. In the passage we were dancing to bhangra," Neetu said, adding, "I wanted...full ghodi ritual, but then....we thought...[paparazzi] would come and it'd become a crazy thing."

60.title: UP policeman dies in accident hours after taking injured man to hospital
60.article_body: A police constable in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki died after his bike hit stray cattle, hours after he rushed a man injured in a fight at an eatery to a hospital. The 25-year-old man succumbed to the injuries at the hospital. The police constable died when he was returning from the hospital along with a colleague.

61.title: Kohli's frustrated reaction after golden duck goes viral, Bangar seen consoling him
61.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli's frustrated reaction after getting out for a golden duck on the first ball of their IPL 2022 match against SRH has gone viral. Several overs after his dismissal, Kohli was seen putting his hand on head. He was also seen hitting a table in frustration. Later, RCB head coach Sanjay Bangar was seen consoling Kohli.

62.title: 2 ancient Swastikas found on Gyanvapi mosque wall by survey team: Reports
62.article_body: Two ancient Swastikas (sacred Hindu symbol) have been found on the outer wall of the Gyanvapi mosque next to Kashi-Vishwanath temple in UP's Varanasi, reports said quoting a court-appointed survey team member. The videographer reportedly said the faded but legible symbols were found beside lotus flowers on the mosque wall. The survey was halted on Saturday by protesters.

63.title: Centre releases revenue deficit grant of ₹7,183 cr to 14 states
63.article_body: The Centre on Friday released ₹7,183 crore as Post Devolution Revenue Deficit (PDRD) grant to 14 states, including West Bengal, Andhra Pradesh, Rajasthan and Punjab. This was the second monthly instalment of the PDRD grant. With this, the amount released in FY23 stands at ₹14,367 crore. The Fifteenth Finance Commission has recommended a total grant of ₹86,201 crore for FY23.

64.title: No matter what I do, people will always think my mom is better: Palak on Shweta
64.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari said being a star kid comes with the pressure of living up to what their parents have created. "No matter what I do, people will always think...my mom is better...That's something...I've never refuted in my life," she added. "For me to grow where she is, it'll take me a lot of time," Palak said.

65.title: Lord Ram doesn’t bless those with fake emotions: Sanjay Raut
65.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday criticised MNS chief Raj Thackeray over his upcoming visit to Ayodhya, saying that Lord Ram does not bless those coming to him with fake emotions and for political reasons. "Aaditya Thackeray has been invited by different sections of society to highlight the true essence of Hindutva," Shiv Sena's chief spokesperson said.

66.title: Development of pacers has improved India's overseas reputation: Ian Chappell
66.article_body: Former Australia captain Ian Chappell has said the development of fast bowlers like Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami and Mohammed Siraj has been instrumental in improving India's overseas reputation. "India's enormous depth in pace bowling is the envy of most countries...Team India has evolved...[to a team] that is extremely difficult to beat under any conditions," he added.

67.title: 2 Palestinians who killed 3 civilians using axes arrested: Israel
67.article_body: Israeli security forces on Sunday said that the two Palestinians who killed three civilians in the Elad city have been arrested. The attackers had allegedly used axes to hack the victims on the country's Independence Day. They were caught by the forces in a forest near Elad. The duo appeared to be unhurt in pictures that surfaced following their arrest.

68.title: Tata Projects shortlisted for Noida airport construction
68.article_body: Tata Projects has been shortlisted to construct the terminal, runway and various other airside and landside facilities at the Noida International Airport in Jewar. As per reports, Tata Projects scored higher than other bidders, Larsen & Toubro and Shapoorji Pallonji Group, under the quality and cost-based selection criteria. It might reportedly get the contract after two-three weeks.

69.title: 19 policemen hurt, 12 vehicles damaged in mob attack at Maha steel factory; 27 held
69.article_body: Nineteen policemen sustained injuries and 12 of their vehicles were damaged when they tried to control an attack on a steel factory's employees by over 100 members of a labour union in Maharashtra's Palghar. So far 27 people have been arrested over the incident that took place on Saturday. The situation is tense, but under control, a police spokesperson said.

70.title: When I was expecting, people said 'This will end your career': Malaika
70.article_body: Malaika Arora, speaking to Humans of Bombay, recalled her pregnancy and revealed that when she was expecting Arhaan, people said her career would come to an end. "Back then, after marriage, you'd barely see an actress on screen," she said, adding, "Two months after delivery...I performed at an award show...In fact, I said yes...for 'Kaal Dhamaal' a year after delivery!"

71.title: Thank you for all the love: Sanjay as his debut film Rocky completes 41 yrs
71.article_body: Sanjay Dutt took to Instagram to share a photo from his debut film, 'Rocky', and celebrated 41 years of being in Bollywood. Alongside the post, he wrote, "Four decades + one year is sure a lifetime of a journey! Thank you for all the love you all gave me as 'Rocky'...I hope to keep entertaining all my fans and well-wishers."

72.title: Facebook to drop Nearby Friends, other location-based features
72.article_body: Facebook has started notifying its users that its Nearby Friends, weather alerts, location history and other location-based features won't be available after May 31, 9to5Mac reported. All user information related to these features will reportedly be deleted from Facebook's servers. Users can download their background location data and location history till August 1, the report added.

73.title: Devotees’ footfall is more than capacity in Char Dham Yatra: U’khand CM
73.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Sunday said that devotees’ footfall in Char Dham Yatra, which is resuming after two years, is more than expected. "We are making all possible arrangements but people are more than the capacity at all the four dhams," Dhami added. "We request devotees to make lodging and other arrangements prior to their arrival," Dhami stated.

74.title: Johnny Depp gets gifts, cards from fans outside court amid trial
74.article_body: A video going viral on social media shows actor Johnny Depp being showered with gifts, cards and bouquets by fans as he waves to them while exiting the court in his car amid his ongoing defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. The video also shows Amber's car exiting the court in silence until a fan of Johnny says, "Lying narcissist."

75.title: Putin busy with Ukraine, Finland & Sweden can join now: NATO ex-chief
75.article_body: Former NATO chief Anders Fogh Rasmussen has said that Finland and Sweden can join the group "exactly now as Russian President Vladimir Putin is preoccupied in Ukraine". "He [Putin] can't do anything about it," he added. He further said that the two countries would be exposed to Russian intimidation and threats if they don't become NATO members now.

76.title: Mumbai-based electronics firm loses ₹7 lakh in cyber fraud
76.article_body: A Mumbai-based electronics firm was duped of ₹7 lakh through email spoofing, according to a police complaint. In an email sent by the accused, an accountant of the company was asked to pay the amount to a Gujarat-based supplier. The fraud was discovered after the supplier informed the firm that no payment has been received.

77.title: Kajal edits Mother's Day post after writer accuses her of copying her poem
77.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal edited her Mother's Day post on Instagram after she was called out by a writer for copying her poem. Kajal has now given credits to the writer and turned off the comments on the post. The writer had claimed that Kajal's post featured an original poem by her and even the caption was copied from her.

78.title: First Made-In-India semi high-speed train set handed over to NCRTC
78.article_body: The first Made-In-India semi high-speed train set for the Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) was handed over to the National Capital Region Transport Corporation (NCRTC) on Saturday, Alstom tweeted. The train has been designed and developed in India by Alstom's local arm. The train is expected to reduce travel time between Delhi and Meerut by 40%, a press release noted.

79.title: Dreaming of becoming Jinnah: BJP on Owaisi's Gyanvapi mosque remark
79.article_body: BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav on Sunday criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and demanded his arrest for his remarks on the Gyanvapi mosque survey, adding that he's dreaming of becoming Jinnah. Yadav said that Owaisi wants to create a rift between Hindus and Muslims in the country, for which a case of sedition should be registered against him.

80.title: 3 dead, several injured as bus falls into gorge in Maharashtra's Raigad
80.article_body: At least three persons died and several others sustained injuries after a bus carrying 35 passengers fell into a gorge in Maharashtra's Raigad district on Sunday. According to preliminary information, the accident took place after the bus plunged around 50-60 feet into the gorge. The passengers were travelling from Thane to attend a function at Shrivardhan village, as per reports.

81.title: 20-yr-old woman found hanging in train's washroom in Maharashtra
81.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was found hanging in the washroom of an express train at a station in Maharashtra on Sunday. A man and a child who accompanied the woman have been absconding. The incident took place on the Swaraj Express train, which runs from Bandra Terminus in Mumbai to Jammu and Kashmir's Katra.

82.title: 5 people arrested in gaming racket in Hyderabad; cash seized
82.article_body: Hyderabad's Madgul Police along with a special operations team (SOT) under Rachakonda Commissionerate busted a gaming racket on Saturday. Reacting to a tip-off, police raided a gaming area in Bramhan pally and arrested five persons in connection with the crime. Police also seized ₹22,065 and two mobile phones from the accused.

83.title: 3 men held for beating gurudwara manager to death in Punjab
83.article_body: Three men were arrested for beating to death Gurudwara Shri Nabha Sahib's manager in Zirakpur on shrine's premises over an argument. According to the complaint, one of the accused had been living in a room on the gurudwara premises. He also opened an office in it along with another accused, following which the manager asked them to vacate the room.

84.title: 19-year-old Carlos 1st player to beat Nadal, Djokovic in same clay court event
84.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz has become the first player ever to beat both Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal in the same clay court tournament. Alcaraz defeated world number one Novak Djokovic 6-7 (5-7), 7-5, 7-6 (7-5) to reach the Madrid Open final. He had earlier defeated Nadal 6-2, 1-6, 6-3 in the quarter-final of the tournament.

85.title: Joe Root will bat at number 4 in Test matches: Ben Stokes
85.article_body: England's newly-appointed Test captain Ben Stokes has said that former skipper Joe Root will bat at number four in England's Test matches. "I've already spoken with Joe. I've asked him to go back to four and I'm going to be at six," Stokes said. "Joe will probably be averaging 90 now instead of 60 so it'll be good," Stokes added.

86.title: Bhubaneswar to host Indian Grand Prix 3 and 4 this month
86.article_body: Bhubaneswar will be hosting the Indian Grand Prix 3 and 4 on May 21 and 24 respectively. The events will be hosted by the Odisha government in collaboration with the Athletics Federation of India and the Odisha Athletics Association. A total of 17 events will be held in the two competitions. Notably, Madurai was previously the designated venue.

87.title: 19-yr-old dies by suicide after being raped by her father in UP
87.article_body: UP's Banda Police on Saturday arrested a 49-year-old labourer for allegedly sexually assaulting his 19-year-old daughter, after which she allegedly died by suicide. The woman's younger sister told the police that their father on Wednesday evening came home in a drunken state and allegedly raped her elder sister, adding that she was depressed and took the extreme step on Thursday.

88.title: Nora gifts dancing gears to underprivileged contestants on her dance show
88.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi gifted dancing gears to a group of aspiring underprivileged dancers on a dance-based reality show. It included athleisure wear, and shoes, in addition, she also created a fund to support their education. The female dancers hailed from a small town in Madhya Pradesh. While interacting with the girls, Nora learnt about the background of these dancers.

89.title: Aaditya Thackeray to visit Ayodhya on non-political visit on June 10: Raut
89.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray will visit Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh on June 10 along with Shiv Sena workers from across the country and will seek blessings there, party leader Sanjay Raut said. "Preparations for welcoming Shiv Sena have started in Ayodhya," Raut added. "It's not at all political," Raut stated.

90.title: Delhi Police's complicity in Jahangirpuri violence must be probed: Court
90.article_body: A Delhi court said there was an "utter failure" on the part of the Delhi Police in stopping a Hanuman Jayanti procession held without permission at Jahangirpuri last month. Police personnel "accompanied the illegal procession" and their complicity, "if any", needs to be investigated, the court said in an order. Issue "seems to have been simply brushed aside", it added.

91.title: Deepika said same thing about 'Jayeshbhai...' trailer & '83': Ranveer
91.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has revealed wife Deepika Padukone is "brutally honest" and "always tells it like it is". He added that she said the same thing after watching '83' and 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' trailer. "She was like, 'What you're doing is quite unprecedented, because you are bonafide mainstream, yet you are able to, time after time, create distinctive characters'," Ranveer said.

92.title: I feel your love every day: Janhvi remembers Sridevi on Mother's Day
92.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor took to Instagram on Sunday to share a post remembering her late mother and actress Sridevi on the occasion of Mother's Day. Sharing an old picture of herself with Sridevi, Janhvi wrote, "Even in your absence, I feel your love every day. Even in your absence, you're the best mother in the world. Love you."

93.title: Odisha woman and son lose money after betting on IPL matches, die by suicide
93.article_body: A 55-year-old woman and her 22-year-old son died by suicide in Odisha after losing money by betting on IPL matches. Police said the woman had borrowed money to get her daughter married four years ago and was under pressure from lenders to repay the money. The deceased's neighbours told police that the woman hadn't had a meal for three days.

94.title: He wanted to say so much, couldn't express: Neetu on Rishi's last interaction
94.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor has revealed that when her husband late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor was on the ventilator, there was no communication. She added that she took an iPad with alphabet and told him to point out what he wanted to say but he couldn't lift his finger. "He wanted to say so much and he couldn't express," Neetu said.

95.title: Big belly was the first thing that came to my mind: Pranitha on pregnancy
95.article_body: Actress Pranitha Subhash, who's expecting her first child with husband Nithin Raju, has said the first thing that came to her mind after the positive pregnancy test was a big belly. "As actors, we're obsessed with our looks...But when you get pregnant, you slowly start to think...there's another human being (growing inside you)...That fact takes over your life," she added.

96.title: 64 school students test +ve for COVID-19 at 2 hostels in Odisha
96.article_body: As many as 64 students from different schools have tested COVID-19 positive at two hostels in Odisha's Rayagada. Following this, the health department has called for the 100% health screening of all boarders in residential schools and the preparation of a school-wise action plan. Odisha reported 71 new cases on Saturday, the highest in about a month and a half.

97.title: We have a lovely bond: Avesh on relationship between LSG's pace unit
97.article_body: LSG pacer Avesh Khan, speaking about the relationship between the team's fast-bowling unit, said, "We four have a lovely bond." LSG's pace unit consists of Avesh, Dushmantha Chameera, Mohsin Khan and Jason Holder. Avesh, who scalped three wickets versus KKR on Saturday, stated Mohsin and Chameera gave LSG a good start in the match which helped reduce pressure on him.

98.title: Who was Anna Jarvis, the founder of Mother's Day?
98.article_body: Anna Jarvis was an American activist who founded Mother's Day in 1908 to honour her mother Ann Reeves Jarvis and all mothers. Ann Reeves spent her life working for causes centred around motherhood including the prevention of child mortality and had a desire for the establishment of such a holiday. Anna managed to fulfil her mother's wish after her death.

99.title: Kohli gets out on 1st ball of the match, records his 3rd golden duck of IPL 2022
99.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli got out for a golden duck on the first delivery of their match against SRH on Sunday. Kohli was caught by Kane Williamson at short midwicket on the bowling of spinner Jagadeesha Suchith. This is the third time that Kohli has been dismissed for a golden duck in IPL 2022.

100.title: RBI rate hike wasn't surprising, its timing was: FM Sitharaman
100.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the recent interest rate hike by the RBI was not surprising for her but its timing was. "It came as a surprise because it came between two monetary policy reviews," she added. For the first time since August 2018, RBI on May 4 raised its key lending rate by 40 basis points to 4.40%.

101.title: KKR's Venkatesh is working hard to come back stronger into squad: McCullum
101.article_body: Talking about Venkatesh Iyer, who was dropped from KKR's last two matches in IPL 2022, head coach Brendon McCullum said the all-rounder is working hard in the nets to make a strong comeback into the squad for the remaining matches. "He's a real talent," he added. Venkatesh has scored 132 runs and has been wicketless from nine matches so far.

102.title: Amount of cricket that is expected of people to play is ridiculous: Stokes
102.article_body: England's newly-appointed Test captain Ben Stokes has said the cricketing schedule needs to be looked at. "It really needs looking at from a workload point of view...I want to play as much as I can for England...but...[it's] not possible," he added. Stokes cited the clash of their three-Test series against NZ and the ODI series against the Netherlands as example.

103.title: List of states with most & least domestic violence against women released
103.article_body: As per the National Family Health Survey-5 report, 29% women (of 18-49 age group) in India faced domestic violence. Accordingly, 44.4% women reported domestic violence in Karnataka, 40% in Bihar, 39.6% in Manipur, 38% in Tamil Nadu and 36.9% in Telangana. Lakshadweep (1.3%), Goa (8.3%), Kerala (9.9%), Sikkim (12%) and Meghalaya (16%) reported the least domestic violence against women.

104.title: If cheap fuel is available, why won't we buy it?: FM on India buying Russian oil
104.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that it made "perfect sense" for India to buy Russian oil if it's being offered at a discounted rate, especially amid inflation. She added, "I think we'll go ahead with what is good for the country. We need cheaper fuel. If it is available, why won't we want to buy it? We will buy it."

105.title: FIR against 2 Mumbai mosques for using loudspeakers for azaan before 6 am
105.article_body: Police have registered cases against functionaries of two mosques in Mumbai for using loudspeakers for the early morning prayers before 6 am. A police constable from Bandra police station complained he had heard the azaan being sounded through a loudspeaker at 5.15 am on Thursday. Another sub-inspector heard the azaan being sounded through a loudspeaker at 5.35 am in Santacruz.

106.title: Raj Police reach news anchor Aman Chopra's UP house to arrest him, find it locked
106.article_body: A team of Rajasthan Police went to UP's Noida to arrest news anchor Aman Chopra over his show on the demolition of a temple in Alwar. The arrest wasn't made as Chopra's house was found locked, Rajasthan Police said, adding that UP Police 'didn't cooperate' with them. Chopra's arrest was stayed by Rajasthan HC in two out of three FIRs.

107.title: Malayalam Mission's Qatar official fired over remark against nurses
107.article_body: Malayalam Mission, an initiative by Kerala government to promote the language, fired its Qatar regional coordinator, Durgadas Sisupalan, over derogatory remarks against nurses. "Under the guise of recruiting nurses…we have come to know that they are being taken [to Gulf countries] for meeting the sexual needs of terrorists," Sisupalan reportedly said at Ananthapuram Hindu Maha Sammelan in Kerala.

108.title: RCB to bat first against SRH, SRH make 2 changes to their playing XI
108.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis won the toss and elected to bat first against SRH in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. RCB are fielding an unchanged side, while SRH have made two changes to their playing XI. Sean Abbott and Shreyas Gopal have been replaced by Fazalhaq Farooqi and Jagadeesha Suchith in SRH's playing XI.

109.title: Minority body seeks report over Bagga 'not being allowed to wear turban' during arrest
109.article_body: After BJP's Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga alleged he wasn't allowed to wear a turban when Punjab Police came to arrest him in Delhi, National Commission for Minorities Chairman Iqbal Singh Lalpura has written to Punjab's chief secretary seeking a report "within seven days". Further, the Punjab unit of the BJP alleged that Bagga's father was thrashed during the arrest.

110.title: Anand Mahindra gifts a house to TN's 'Idli Amma' on Mother's Day; shares video
110.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra gifted a house to Tamil Nadu's M Kamalathal on the occasion of Mother's Day. Kamalathal, who is fondly known as 'Idli Amma', has been cooking and selling idlis for ₹1 for the past 30 years. "She's the embodiment of a Mother's virtues...A privilege to be able to support her and her work," Mahindra tweeted, sharing her video.

111.title: Two-day training camp for Haj volunteers being held in Mumbai
111.article_body: The Union Minister of Minority Affairs, Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi, on Saturday inaugurated a two-day training camp for Khadim-ul-Hujjaj (haj volunteers) at the Haj House in Mumbai. Over 400 people, including 12 women, will undergo training at the camp. In a tweet, Naqvi said that 79,237 Indians will go for Haj this year, half of them women.

112.title: Top Infibeam executive R Srikanth, wife murdered by driver in Chennai after US return
112.article_body: R Srikanth, the head of corporate finance at finance company Infibeam, and his wife Anuradha were murdered by their driver Krishna in Mylapore in Chennai on Saturday. Srikanth and Anuradha had just returned to India after visiting their daughter in US. Krishna was arrested from Andhra Pradesh while attempting to escape to Nepal with some looted items in a car.

113.title: Arshdeep has been brilliant: Punjab Kings skipper Mayank Agarwal
113.article_body: Punjab Kings skipper Mayank Agarwal has said that pacer Arshdeep Singh has "been nothing short of brilliant" for their franchise in this year's IPL. "He (Arshdeep) puts his hand up when the team needs it. He has been a leader...and it has been fantastic for us. We have to make the best use of our resources," Agarwal said.

114.title: Dating apps being used by sex offenders to lure people: Hyd Police
114.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police warned on Sunday that sex offenders are using dating applications and social media platforms to lure people into prostitution and human trafficking. Most victims of sex trafficking are from Bangladesh, who are offered fake job offers in metropolitan cities, officials said. Police also shared a helpline number for citizens to report any illegal activities.

115.title: Knew hard length would work against Russell: LSG pacer Avesh Khan
115.article_body: After winning against KKR by 75 runs, LSG pacer Avesh Khan has said that he knew that the "hard length ball" would work against KKR all-rounder Andre Russell. "The attempt was to get Russell out...My aim was to go with the hard lengths even if that goes for six. His wicket was the best of the three," Khan said.

116.title: 8-year-old boy killed by crocodile while bathing in Uttar Pradesh
116.article_body: An eight-year-old boy was killed by a crocodile when the former was having a bath in a pond in a village located in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich district. The deceased had gone with his sister to the pond on Saturday afternoon. However, his body was recovered by the forest department's divers only on Sunday morning, officials said.

117.title: Bride-to-be returning from shopping among 5 killed in accident in U'khand
117.article_body: A 25-year-old woman, who was returning from shopping for her wedding scheduled for May 12, and four others were killed after their car fell into a 250-metre-deep gorge on the Rishikesh-Badrinath highway in Uttarakhand on Sunday. The car was on its way to Chamoli from Rishikesh. The victims included two children aged 12 and 15.

118.title: I get mom guilt; if they miss me, I miss them ten folds more: Neha
118.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia in an interview has stated that her mom guilt is something that she sometimes externalises and sometimes internalises. She added, "I feel like if they miss me, I miss them ten folds more." The actress further said that she and her husband actor Angad Bedi try to do as much for their children as they can.

119.title: Saddened to witness rising violence against doctors: CJI NV Ramana
119.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana on Saturday said that he was "extremely saddened" to witness rising violence against doctors. "Several false cases are being lodged against upright and hardworking doctors…They need a better and more secure working environment," CJI added. "This is where professional medical associations assume great significance," CJI stated.

120.title: NCB raids pharmacy firm in Hyderabad, seizes ₹3.7 crore in cash, one held
120.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) busted a digital pharmacy group, suspected to be involved in a global pharma drug trafficking network, in Hyderabad's Domalguda and seized ₹3.71 crore in cash along with several electronic gadgets. The NCB also arrested a person for allegedly carrying out over one thousand illicit diversions and drug shipments from India to the USA, officials said.

121.title: Chahal would be firm favourite to go to T20 WC: Shaun Pollock
121.article_body: Former South Africa captain Shaun Pollock has said RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who's currently the highest wicket-taker in the ongoing IPL season, is a "firm favourite" to be part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "Chahal wasn't anywhere near the right form when it came to the last World Cup," added Pollock.

122.title: 50-yr-old Pune man killed in sleep after being mistaken for his son
122.article_body: A 50-year-old man was killed with a sharp weapon at his home by a 19-year-old man who mistook him for his son in the dark in Pune. The victim was asleep and had suffered multiple injuries on his neck, shoulder and back in the attack. The accused had entered his home to kill his son who has a criminal record.

123.title: Delhi youth beaten to death by over 15 people on suspicion of being informer
123.article_body: A 20-year-old youth was allegedly beaten to death in Delhi by a group of over 15 people who suspected he was a police informer. Police said they have arrested five men and apprehended four juveniles. "During Holi, my brother had put colour on a woman friend. The accused objected to this and they got into a fight," deceased's sister said.

124.title: I stepped out with brave front only for my kids: Shilpa Shetty
124.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty has stated that she stepped out with a brave front during "difficult times" only for her children Viaan and Samisha. The actress further said that she wanted to show her son that one must have work ethics even in difficult times. This comes amid her husband Raj Kundra's arrest and bail in the porn films case.

125.title: Congress' Nirmala Gahtori to take on U'khand CM Dhami in bypoll
125.article_body: Congress has fielded senior leader Nirmala Gahtori against Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami in the upcoming Assembly bypoll for Champawat seat. The voting will take place on May 31 and the result will be declared on June 3. The bypoll was necessitated after former BJP MLA Kailash Chandra Gahtori vacated the seat for Dhami, who had lost election from Khatima.

126.title: We don't need to  acquire new assets to grow: Tata Steel MD
126.article_body: Tata Steel MD and CEO TV Narendran said the firm will look to grow organically and doesn't "really need to acquire new assets to grow [output]". "We will rely more on organic growth during this decade," Narendran said. "Right now, costs are stable, so steel prices are stable. We are comfortable with that," he added.

127.title: I was supposed to be India captain, then the Greg Chappell incident happened: Yuvraj
127.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh has revealed he was supposed to become India captain, but couldn't due to the Greg Chappell incident. "It had become Chappell or Sachin Tendulkar. I was probably the only player who supported...my teammate. Some...BCCI officials didn't like it," Yuvraj added. He stated, "It was said that they should make anybody the captain but not myself."

128.title: Local UK election result decided on coin toss as both candidates get equal votes
128.article_body: The result of a local election in the UK was decided by the toss of a coin after both the candidates received the exact number of votes. A video of this also surfaced on social media. The vote for Llanfoist Fawr and Govilon counties was decided with a toss with the result coming in favour of Tory candidate Tomos Davies.

129.title: Watched Oye Lucky! Lucky Oye! to prepare for my role in 'Band...': Ranveer
129.article_body: Recalling the time when he auditioned for his debut film 'Band Baaja Baaraat', actor Ranveer Singh said, "I gave the audition for 'Band Baaja Baaraat,' and I was told that the role is of a 21-year-old boy from Delhi." "I worked on my accent by watching all the Delhi based films...such as Dibakar Banerjee's 'Oye Lucky! Lucky Oye!'," he added.

130.title: Ukrainian drone destroys Russian ship near Snake Island in Black Sea; video released
130.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday said it has destroyed another Russian ship near Snake Island in the Black Sea. Ukraine's Defence Ministry said an armed drone destroyed a Serna-class landing craft. "The traditional parade of the Russian Black Sea fleet on May 9 this year will be held near Snake Island - at the bottom of the sea," Ukraine's Defence Ministry tweeted.

131.title: Gyanvapi mosque survey stopped as protesters deny entry to court-appointed team
131.article_body: The survey of the Gyanvapi mosque near Kashi Vishwanath temple in UP was halted on Saturday after some protesters denied entry to the Advocate Commissioner Ajai Kumar and other court-appointed lawyers. Kumar said, "Some Muslims gathered at the entrance and didn't let us enter." Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee (Gyanvapi) filed a court petition seeking Kumar's replacement, accusing him of 'bias'.

132.title: Musk to launch new Twitter product, expects 104 million users by 2028: NYT
132.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk, who's acquiring Twitter for $44 billion, plans to launch a new Twitter product called "X", according to his investor presentation obtained by The New York Times. Musk expects to launch the product in 2023 and estimates it would have nine million subscribers in its first year and 104 million subscribers by 2028, the NYT reported.

133.title: People coming from different beliefs can work together: Munawar on Kangana
133.article_body: Munawar Faruqui, who won 'Lock Upp', spoke about working with Kangana Ranaut, who hosted the show. "That's the beauty of...a democratic country...You may come from different beliefs but you can always work together," he said, adding, "Many...raised questions about me doing this show...But I knew it was a means to connect with fans...and I was successful in doing that."

134.title: Delhi Capitals forced into isolation after net bowler tests COVID-19 positive: Reports
134.article_body: The Delhi Capitals (DC) contingent has been forced into isolation after a net bowler tested positive for COVID-19. This comes just hours before DC were scheduled to face CSK in their 11th IPL 2022 match in Mumbai. Earlier in the season, six members of the DC contingent had tested positive for the virus.

135.title: Best investment you'll make: Poonawalla suggests Musk to make Tesla cars in India
135.article_body: The Serum Institute of India's Adar Poonawalla on Sunday suggested Tesla CEO Elon Musk to invest in India by manufacturing Tesla cars in the country. Poonawalla wrote, "Just in case you don't end up buying Twitter, do look at investing...in India for high-quality large-scale manufacturing of Tesla cars. I assure you this will be the best investment you'll ever make."

136.title: Shehnaaz Gill dances with Brahma Kumaris on Punjabi folk song, video surfaces
136.article_body: A video of Shehnaaz Gill dancing with Brahma Kumaris on a Punjabi folk song at an event in Delhi has surfaced online. The actress, who was invited to launch the Empowerment of Girl Child campaign, also delivered a speech on girl empowerment. "Stop calling girls soft, delicate, innocent. We are not helpless at all," Shehnaaz said at the event.

137.title: AAP demands Himachal govt’s resignation after Khalistan flags incident
137.article_body: After Khalistan flags were seen tied to the main gate of Himachal Pradesh’s Vidhan Sabha building in Dharamshala, AAP said nothing can be more "shameful" than this. "Your government has no right to continue in power, the entire government should resign immediately," AAP Himachal Pradesh tweeted. "Jairam Thakurji, your government allowed this incident despite heavy security," AAP added.

138.title: Raashii Khanna gifts her mom a BMW 740li worth over ₹1.40 cr, pics surfaces
138.article_body: Actress Raashii Khanna gifted her mother a premium BMW 740li worth over ₹1.40 cr on the occasion of Mother's Day. She opted for a classic blue metallic colour, which has coordinated interiors in dark brown colour. In the picture that has surfaced online, Raashii, along with her parents can be seen posing with the new car.

139.title: My beautiful mothers: Alia shares pic with Soni and Neetu on Mother's Day
139.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt wished Mother's Day to her mother, Soni Razdan, and mother-in-law, Neetu Kapoor. The actress shared an unseen picture from her and her husband Ranbir Kapoor's wedding reception in which she posed with her two mothers. She captioned the photo, "My beautiful beautiful mothers. Happy Mother's Day. All day every day!"

140.title: Kajal Aggarwal copies poem, caption from Instagram user for Mother's Day, gets called out
140.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal has been called out for copying an Instagram user's poem and caption for her post on Mother's Day. "My Dear Mum poem passed off as original work by Kajal Aggarwal," writer Sarah wrote on Instagram. "The weird copy of my original caption with...a few words swapped out makes me think it isn't an honest mistake," she added.

141.title: Kane needs to turn from William to Villain and attack with bat: Shoaib Akhtar
141.article_body: Ahead of SRH's game against RCB, ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said SRH captain Kane Williamson, who has so far scored 199 runs in 10 games at a strike rate of 96.14 in IPL 2022, needs to show aggression with the bat. "Kane needs to turn from William to villain...He needs to score, otherwise SRH (will be in trouble)," added Akhtar.

142.title: Comedian Munawar Faruqui wins Lock Upp season 1, gets ₹20-lakh cash prize
142.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui has won the first season of reality show 'Lock Upp', while Payal Rohatgi finished as runner-up of the show hosted by Kangana Ranaut. Munawar has been awarded a cash prize of ₹20 lakh, a brand-new car and a trip to Italy for winning the show. The show's grand finale took place on May 7.

143.title: Khalistan flags put up at Himachal Pradesh Assembly in Dharamshala
143.article_body: Khalistan flags were found tied to the main gate and boundary wall of the Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly in Dharamshala on Sunday morning. "It could be an act of some tourists from Punjab. We're going to register a case today," SP Kangra Kushal Sharma said. State CM Jairam Thakur condemned the "cowardly act" and said it will not be "tolerated".

144.title: Rahul says 2 LPG cylinders in 2014 are worth 'price of 1 now'
144.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday compared the price of LPG cylinders under the Congress in 2014 and under BJP in 2022, saying, "Two cylinders then for the price of one now." He claimed that in 2014, LPG cylinder was worth ₹410, while in 2022 it's worth ₹999. "Only Congress governs for...welfare of poor and middle-class Indian families," he said.

145.title: Ukraine war affecting China's calculations on Taiwan: US spy chief
145.article_body: US Central Intelligence Agency chief William Burns on Saturday claimed that Ukraine war has affected China's calculations on gaining control over Taiwan. He said that Chinese President Xi Jinping is looking "carefully at what lessons to draw" for Taiwan. He also claimed that Jinping is "unsettled" by the reputational damage that can come from association with Russia's "brutishness" in Ukraine.

146.title: Yashasvi must have thought 'How did I lose my place in the XI': Sehwag
146.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said RR's Yashasvi Jaiswal must have been hurt after getting dropped from the playing XI after playing three matches in IPL 2022. "He must have [thought], 'How did I lose my place? I was retained but someone else is playing'. When a player is hurt, expect him to do well when he comes back," stated Sehwag.

147.title: Doesn't make any sense: Tejashwi on Kishor's remark of 'no development'
147.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that poll strategist Prashant Kishor's statement of "no development" in Bihar for the past 30 years is "baseless". "Kishor's statement does not make any sense. I am not aware of his whereabouts...who is he? He has never been a factor in anything so far," Yadav said.

148.title: 22-year-old man arrested over 9 armed robberies in Pune in 2 days
148.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested on Saturday while his associate is absconding for allegedly being involved in nine armed robberies that took place in parts of Pune in two days. The duo, who roamed on a two-wheeler, had injured a few people and escaped with mobiles, wallets, cash and gold chains. The arrested accused was previously booked in other cases.

149.title: Bengaluru to face water supply disruption for 18 hrs tomorrow
149.article_body: Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board (BWSSB) has announced that parts of the city will face water supply disruption tomorrow for 18 hours. The water supply will be affected between 3 am and 9 pm. The board said that this was due to the emergency shutdown of Cauvery water supply treatment plant and pumping stations at TK Halli and Tataguni.

150.title: Kajal Aggarwal shares first glimpse of son on Mother's Day, pens note
150.article_body: Kajal Aggarwal, who welcomed her first son with Gautam Kitchlu in April, shared the first glimpse of her son on Sunday on the occasion of Mother's Day. She also penned a note wherein she wrote, "I want you to know how precious you are and always will be to me." "You've taught me what it is to be...mother," Kajal added.

151.title: Galwan valley martyr's wife becomes Lieutenant, says 'It was my husband's dream'
151.article_body: Rekha Singh, the wife of Lance Naik and Vir Chakra awardee Deepak Singh has become a Lieutenant in the Indian Army. Deepak Singh was martyred during a clash with the Chinese People's Liberation Army in Galwan valley. "It was my husband's dream that pushed me to strive hard to make it to the Indian Army," said Lieutenant Rekha Singh.

152.title: 22-year-old woman hit by truck in Mumbai, dies
152.article_body: A woman (22) died and another woman (26) was injured after a dumper truck hit them in the Shivaji Nagar locality of Mumbai's Govandi area. The deceased, identified as Arshiya Khan, was riding pillion with her associate on a scooty when the incident took place, police said. Notably, the accused was held and booked under IPC's Section 304-A.

153.title: 2 killed, 60 feared dead as Russia bombs Ukraine school: Governor
153.article_body: At least two people were killed and 60 others, trapped under debris, are feared dead after Russian forces bombed a school in Ukrainian village of Bilohorivka, said Governor of the Luhansk region on Sunday. As many as 90 people were sheltering in the school that was engulfed by fire, out of which 30 have been rescued, he said.

154.title: Badrinath Dham shrine opens for devotees today
154.article_body: The portals of Badrinath Dham opened for devotees on Sunday morning with rituals and chanting and the tunes of Army band. The temple has been decorated with flowers and lights. The shrine is one of the four ancient pilgrimage sites referred to as 'Char Dham' which also includes Yamunotri, Gangotri and Kedarnath.

155.title: Man banged my car, gave rape threats, his wife also got aggressive: TV actress Mahhi Vij
155.article_body: TV actress Mahhi Vij took to Twitter to take Mumbai Police's help, claiming that a man banged her car and got abusive. Sharing a video showing the number plate of the man's vehicle, Mahhi wrote, "[He] gave me rape threats. His wife got [also] got aggressive. @MumbaiPolice, help me find this guy who is threat to us."

156.title: Vicky shares pics with mom Veena & mom-in-law Suzanne Turquotte on Mother's Day
156.article_body: Vicky Kaushal shared pictures with his mother, Veena Kaushal, and mother-in-law, Suzanne Turquotte, on Mother's Day. The pictures were from his wedding with Katrina Kaif, which took place in December. In the first photo, Vicky can be seen dancing with his mother in his Baraat. He also shared a picture with Katrina's mother, wherein he is seen taking her blessings.

157.title: China-backed John Lee becomes Hong Kong's new leader
157.article_body: John Lee, who is said to be backed by the Chinese regime, was elected as the new leader of Hong Kong on Sunday. He would replace the incumbent leader, Carrie Lam, as the Chief Executive on July 1. Lee, who was the lone candidate in the election, secured 1,416 votes, comfortably surpassing the 751-mark needed to win.

158.title: Putin believes he can't afford to lose: US spy chief on Ukraine war
158.article_body: US Central Intelligence Agency Director William Burns said on Saturday that Russian President Vladimir Putin "doesn't believe he can afford to lose" in Ukraine and so "stakes are high" in the war. He added that Putin had been "stewing" over Ukraine for years. "I think [Putin's] convinced right now that doubling down...will enable him to make progress," he further said.

159.title: Still can't think of any game where we had a complete performance: Rahul
159.article_body: After their eighth win in 11 games in IPL 2022, LSG captain KL Rahul said he still can't think of a game this season where they had a "complete performance". He added, "I don't think any team is going to be perfect...[but] still [there are] areas to improve." Currently, LSG are at the top of the IPL points table.

160.title: I've some weird fascination with number 8, I like the way it looks: Ranbir
160.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, who's in Dubai to attend Celebrity Football Cup 2022, said during a press conference that he has "some weird fascination" with the number 8. "It is my mother's (Neetu Kapoor) birthday, 8th July, and I also like the whole way the number looks, because it is the infinity sign if you look at it horizontally," he added.

161.title: Disha Patani joins the cast of Prabhas & Deepika starrer 'Project K'
161.article_body: Disha Patani has joined the cast of Prabhas and Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Project K'. Taking to her Instagram Story, Disha shared a snapshot of a welcome gift basket that she received from Vyjayanthi Movies. The welcome note read, "Project K welcomes you! We are thrilled to have you on board!" The gift basket included a bunch of red and pink roses.

162.title: Karan Johar starts shooting for Koffee with Karan Season 7
162.article_body: Karan Johar has started shooting for the seventh season of his talk show, 'Koffee with Karan'. Taking to Instagram Stories, he shared a picture of Koffee with Karan mug, writing, "And so it begins." According to reports, the first episode will be shot with Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt, who'll be seen in Karan's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'.

163.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for Odisha, Andhra, Bengal due to Cyclone Asani
163.article_body: The deep depression over southeast Bay of Bengal moved west northwestwards with a speed of 16 kmph during past 6 hours and intensified into a cyclonic storm 'Asani', the IMD said on Sunday. Cyclone Asani could bring light to moderate rain with heavy rain in isolated areas in Odisha, West Bengal and Andhra Pradesh from Tuesday, the IMD added.

164.title: Andhra Sub-Inspector held for abetting 21-yr-old woman’s suicide
164.article_body: A police Sub-Inspector (SI) from Andhra Pradesh was arrested for allegedly abetting a 21-year-old woman's suicide. He purportedly cheated the woman in the name of love. "The woman consumed pesticide two days ago after she learnt that the SI recently married another woman," police said. She succumbed while undergoing treatment in a hospital on Friday.

165.title: 52-yr-old Kami Rita Sherpa scales Mt Everest for 26th time, breaks his own world record
165.article_body: Nepalese mountaineer Kami Rita Sherpa has scaled Mount Everest for 26th time, breaking his own world record of 25 ascents set last year. The 52-year-old had scaled Mount Everest for the first time on May 13, 1994. Kami Rita holds the record for climbing peaks above 8,000 metres the maximum number of times.

166.title: Shooters fire over 10 rounds at a car on busy Delhi road, video surfaces
166.article_body: Some armed men fired over 10 rounds at a car on a busy road in Delhi's Subhash Nagar area on Saturday night. An ex-chairman of a local mandi and his brother have been injured in the incident and are said to be in a critical condition. A CCTV footage of the incident has surfaced online. Police are investigating the matter.

167.title: Kejriwal is scared of him: Bagga’s father after midnight court hearing
167.article_body: Soon after BJP’s Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga was released from Punjab Police custody in Haryana, his father, Preetpal Singh Bagga, said AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal is "scared" of his son. "Arvind Kejriwal is scared of him as he's exposing his wrongdoings," Preetpal said. Tajinder was granted relief by Punjab and Haryana High Court, which held an urgent hearing at midnight.

168.title: Alarmed: UN chief on Taliban making face cover must for women
168.article_body: UN Secretary-General António Guterres on Sunday said that he's "alarmed" over Taliban's decree which makes face covering a requirement for Afghan women in public and asks them to not leave their homes unless necessary. "I...urge Taliban to keep their promises to Afghan women," he added. Male guardians will be punished if women don't cover their faces, the decree also states.

169.title: Only those who pay Krushna & my bills can question us: Kashmera Shah
169.article_body: When asked if she and Krushna faced any opposition when they were planning to get married, actress Kashmera Shah said, "Only those who pay Krushna and my bills can question us." "Those who are seething with anger that we are successful, married, have kids and are happy can go suck their thumbs," she added.

170.title: Man stabbed to death over an argument in UP's Jaunpur, 3 held
170.article_body: A man was stabbed to death and another injured over an argument at the Gaura Badshahpur area in Jaunpur, Uttar Pradesh. Three people have been arrested for the alleged murder while four people have been arrested for allegedly protesting against the murder in which the Jaunpur-Azamgarh highway was blocked as well. The deceased is identified as Badal Yadav (22).

171.title: Mumbai's Sion Flyover to remain closed every weekend till June 20
171.article_body: The Sion Flyover in Mumbai will remain closed for vehicular traffic every weekend till June 20. The decision has been taken to enable the Maharashtra State Road Development Corporation to carry out the repair work. Alternative routes have been formed by the traffic police which will be implemented from 5 pm on Friday till 6 am on Monday.

172.title: Nothing is well-settled in KKR, they are looking insecure: Jaffer
172.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said "nothing is well-settled" in KKR and there are insecurities in the team which are reflected in their performance in the ongoing IPL season. "You can look at their top-order and the death bowling as well...they have not found the right combination," he added. KKR have lost seven of their 11 games so far.

173.title: Protests held in US cities in support of abortion rights
173.article_body: Hundreds of people took out rallies in support of abortion rights in multiple cities across the US, including Chicago, Atlanta and Houston, on Saturday. This comes after a leaked Supreme Court draft opinion reportedly suggested overturning a landmark ruling that legalised abortion. In Atlanta, the protesters chanted, "Not the church and not the state, women must decide our fate."

174.title: Venkatesh didn't get runs, we were forced to look for other options: McCullum
174.article_body: Opening up on dropping all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer from the playing XI after nine games, KKR head coach Brendon McCullum said they were forced to look for other options as the 27-year-old didn't get runs. "He's working hard [in] the nets, trying to get his form back...He's certainly not out of contention for the games to come," added McCullum.

175.title: Pro-Russia parade likely in Germany on May 9 Victory Day: Intel
175.article_body: The German intelligence said it expects pro-Russia parades and demonstrations on May 9 on the occasion of Victory Day. The day marks Soviet army's win over Nazi Germany. "Pro-Russian activities such as car parades and demonstrations are to be expected all over Germany, possibly also showing the 'Z' symbol of the Russian army invading Ukraine," said the intelligence chief.

176.title: Shimron Hetmyer leaves RR bio-bubble, to return after birth of first child
176.article_body: RR batter Shimron Hetmyer has left the RR bio-bubble and has travelled back to Guyana for the imminent birth of his first child. "Babies are born only once and this will be my first...It's only because of a special emergency that I'm leaving," Hetmyer said in a video shared by RR. He'll return following the birth of his first child.

177.title: Police serving political masters can break up federalism: Chidambaram
177.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Saturday said police serving their respective "political masters" will lead to the ultimate breakdown of federalism that is already in peril. Chidambaram was reacting to the arrest of BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga by the Punjab Police. "The 'autonomy' of each state police force must stop at the border of another state," Chidambaram tweeted.

178.title: Pak drone spotted in J&K's Arnia, returns after firing by BSF
