178.article_body: BSF opened fire at a drone coming from Pakistan side that crossed the International Border at Jammu and Kashmir's Arnia on Saturday. The drone had "hardly" crossed the border when eight rounds were fired at it, following which it returned to Pakistan side, a BSF officer said. A search operation was conducted and nothing suspicious was found, the officer added.

179.title: If a girl asks for condom at the chemist, it becomes a talking point: Nushrratt
179.article_body: Speaking about condoms being a taboo issue in our society, actress Nushrratt Bharuccha, who'll be next seen in 'Janhit Mein Jaari', said, "If a girl asks for a condom at the chemist...it becomes a talking point." "We were shooting in Chanderi and if I had gone and asked for a condom, the whole town would've come to know!" he added.

180.title: 3 children among 5 of family drown in quarry in Maharashtra's Thane district
180.article_body: Five members of a family, including three children, drowned in a water-filled quarry in Thane district. Police said a child slipped and fell into the water and to save the child, the others also jumped into the water. The deceased were identified as Meera Gaikwad (55), her daughter-in-law Apeksha Gaikwad (30) and grandchildren Mayuresh (14), Moksha (13) and Siddhesh (14).

181.title: I love lassi, I love how it cools palate if you're hot-hit with curry: Benedict
181.article_body: Benedict Cumberbatch in an interview said he loves lassi, adding that he loves how it cools the palate "especially if you're a hot-hit with...curry". The actor, who taught English at a Tibetan monastery in Darjeeling at the age of 19, added, "Tibetan tea I got an odd kind of taste for, which is saying something. It's kind of...buttery and salty."

182.title: Salary pending for 5 months, MCD teachers declare strike
182.article_body: The municipal school teachers' union has announced a strike to be held on Monday over the delay in salary disbursement by Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD). The salaries of many of the teachers are reportedly pending for five months in EDMC. "There is five months of pendency in East MCD and two months in North MCD," said the union chief.

183.title: We knew he was due for a good innings: Samson on Yashasvi's 68(41)
183.article_body: Talking about Yashasvi Jaiswal's 68-run innings against PBKS, RR captain Sanju Samson said they knew the 20-year-old was due for a good innings as he was spending a lot of hours in the nets. "[I'm] very happy for him," added Samson. This was Yashasvi's fourth game and first fifty-plus score in IPL 2022. RR defeated PBKS by six wickets.

184.title: 21-yr-old man held for posing as policeman, extorting money in Mohali
184.article_body: A 21-year-old unemployed man was arrested for posing as a policeman to extort money from commuters at a fake check post in Mohali's Phase 6. "He got the fake uniform stitched through a tailor for ₹4,000 and had been going around in his car, extorting money from unwary people by posing as a cop," a police official said.

185.title: 30% women in 18-49 age bracket in India faced physical violence: NFHS
185.article_body: Nearly one-third of women in India have experienced physical or sexual violence, according to the National Family Health Survey-5 report released by Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya. As per the report, 30% of women between the age of 18 and 49 have experienced physical violence since the age of 15 years, while 6% have experienced sexual violence in their lifetime.

186.title: Munawar Faruqui wins Lock Upp season 1, gets ₹20 lakh cash prize
186.article_body: Stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui became the first winner of the reality show 'Lock Upp' on Saturday's grand finale episode. Along with the trophy, he won a cash prize of ₹20 lakh, a Maruti Suzuki Ertiga and a fully sponsored trip to Italy. Meanwhile, actress Payal Rohatgi finished as the first runner-up of the Kangana Ranaut-hosted show.

187.title: Yuzvendra Chahal records most wickets by an RR spinner in an IPL season
187.article_body: RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has set the record for taking the most wickets by an RR spinner in an IPL season. With his three-wicket haul against PBKS, Chahal took his tally of wickets in IPL 2022 to 22. He broke the record held by leg-spinner Shreyas Gopal, who had taken 20 wickets for RR in IPL 2019.

188.title: No coercive action against Tajinder Bagga till May 10: Punjab & Haryana HC at midnight
188.article_body: Hours after a Mohali court issued a non-bailable warrant against him, Delhi BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga was granted relief by Punjab and Haryana High Court, which held an urgent hearing at midnight. "The HC has ordered no coercive action shall be taken against him till the next hearing on May 10," said Bagga's counsel, senior advocate Anil Mehta.

189.title: Everybody has their helplessness: Bobby on not starring in Imtiaz's Jab We Met
189.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol spoke about not being a part of filmmaker Imtiaz Ali's film 'Jab We Met'. He said that earlier, Imtiaz used to be his "very good friend". "Everybody has their helplessness and they take decisions," he added. "Maybe one friend's decision makes the other friend feel bad. It keeps on happening," Bobby said.

190.title: Bomb scare in Delhi’s Vasant Vihar after foreigner leaves bags
190.article_body: Two bags, which according to locals were left unattended by a foreigner, triggered a bomb scare at a market in Delhi's Vasant Vihar on Saturday. The police cordoned off the area and evacuated people in an operation only to find clothes and other items in the bags. "There was no suspicious or illegal item in the two bags," said police.

191.title: Khalistan flags found tied to main gate at Himachal's Vidhan Sabha
191.article_body: Khalistan flags were seen tied to the main gate of Himachal Pradesh's Vidhan Sabha building in Dharamshala on Sunday. Kangra SP Kushal Sharma said that the flags, which have now been removed, could have been put up by "some tourists from Punjab". He added that the act could have taken place early in the morning or late at night.

192.title: In film industry, you can lose work because of miscommunication: Kartik
192.article_body: Speaking about miscommunication in the film industry, actor Kartik Aaryan said, "Many times miscommunication happens in...industry. Not only in this industry, but it also happens in every industry," he said. "Sometimes this can be good for you but sometimes you can lose work because of it. But I believe...the industry is going through a good phase [now]," he added.

193.title: Fire breaks out in a hospital in Hyderabad, no casualties reported
193.article_body: A fire broke out at the Sri Vani Hospital, also known as Old Farhat Hospital, located in the Malakpet area of Hyderabad on Saturday. During the rescue operation by the firefighters, 19 people were rescued from the spot, fire officials said. Notably, no casualties were reported but one of the two buildings of the hospital got gutted in the fire.

194.title: India reports 3,451 new COVID-19 cases, 40 deaths in 24 hours
194.article_body: India has reported 3,451 COVID-19 cases, 3,079 recoveries and 40 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,805 COVID-19 cases and 22 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 20,635, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,064.

195.title: We are not able to capitalise on small things, LSG outplayed us: Shreyas
195.article_body: After their seventh defeat in 11 games in the ongoing IPL season, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said they have not been able to capitalise on small things during their matches. On their 75-run defeat against LSG, Shreyas said, "They outplayed us in both the departments, batting and bowling...we leaked a lot of runs in death overs...They posted a nice total."

196.title: Bengaluru police arrest 3 for cheating people through investments
196.article_body: Bengaluru City DCP (North East Division) Anoop A Shetty tweeted on Saturday that the police have arrested three people from Bellary who used to allegedly cheat people by taking money for investing in share markets. He added that the accused used to offer "high returns" on the investments. Furthermore, he urged people to verify companies before investing.

197.title: People won’t forgive those who’ve robbed J&K of unique status: Farooq
197.article_body: People won’t forgive those who have "robbed" Jammu and Kashmir of its unique status, prized historical individuality and dignity, Farooq Abdullah, National Conference chief, said. "The BJP and its proxies will be punished by the people of J&K," he added. There is anger brewing among people due to the bad policies of the current government, Abdullah stated.

198.title: Greenboards to replace blackboards in Pune Zilla Parishad schools
198.article_body: The Pune Zilla Parishad is set to replace the existing blackboards in schools with green chalkboards. "Under the Guardian Minister School Development scheme, we have decided to replace blackboards with green chalk boards. According to experts, these green boards are better for visibility and help make learning more interactive," Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said.

199.title: How can CSK still qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs?
199.article_body: Defending champions CSK are currently ninth on IPL 2022 points table. CSK would require to win each of their remaining four matches with a big margin to stand a chance to qualify for playoffs with 14 points. CSK would also need results of other matches to go their way, with MI winning each of their remaining matches except against CSK.

200.title: Man whose marriage proposal was rejected caused Indore fire that killed 7: Police
200.article_body: A case has been registered against a 27-year-old man for allegedly causing a fire at a three-storey building in Indore in which seven people were killed and nine injured. Police said Shubham aka Sanjay Dixit allegedly torched the scooter of a woman who rejected his marriage offer. Police added they found a man ignited the blaze after scanning CCTV footage.

201.title: Pune records 33 new COVID-19 infections; active cases at 262
201.article_body: Pune district recorded 33 new COVID-19 cases, while the number of active cases stood at 262, the state health department said on Saturday. Pune rural reported one new case, while the number was 22 in the city and 10 in PCMC. The district has registered a total of around 14.5 lakh cases since the pandemic began.

202.title: Pune public transport service plans to provide Wi-Fi on buses
202.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) board has taken up the plan to provide Wi-Fi services on buses in a bid to increase ridership and explore non-ticketing revenue, the body's Joint Managing Director Chetana Kerure said. She added that this was done following a successful trial last week. PMPML is also planning to add electric boards for advertisements.

203.title: Cong must first enact farm loan waivers in states it rules: KTR
203.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday responded to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's 'Warangal declaration', saying the party should first implement the waivers in states it rules. "There's nothing new in the declaration he made yesterday," Rao added. Gandhi has promised ₹2 lakh farm loan waivers and fair and accurate MSP if Congress is elected to power in Telangana.

204.title: Punjab jail officer suspended over fake lemon purchase entries
204.article_body: A jail officer in Punjab has reportedly been suspended for allegedly adding fake entries for purchase of lemons for inmates during last month's price rise. An inquiry was ordered after Kapurthala Modern Jail's inmates claimed they didn't get any lemons despite records showing that about 50 kg of lemons were purchased. The investigation revealed several irregularities, including misuse of funds.

205.title: Will hold talks if Naxals show faith in Constitution: Chhattisgarh CM
205.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said that the state government is ready to hold discussions with Naxals if they "express faith in the Constitution". Recently, a press release was issued by the Dandakaranya Special Zonal Committee (DKSZC) spokesperson, Vikalp, stating Maoists were ready to hold talks with the government if their demands were fulfilled.

206.title: Sanskrit can take us from darkness to light: JP Nadda
206.article_body: Speaking at an event organised by the Central Sanskrit University (CSU) in Delhi, BJP National President JP Nadda described Sanskrit as a "means of taking us from darkness to light". "We need to preserve Sanskrit because...it is a way to achieve advancements in various dimensions of our society," he said. Sanskrit is a part of India's culture, Nadda added.

207.title: LSG dismiss KKR for their lowest total in IPL 2022, go top of points table
207.article_body: LSG defeated KKR by 75 runs on Saturday to go top of the IPL 2022 points table. LSG have now won four matches in a row. LSG put up a total of 176/7 and dismissed KKR for 101 in 14.3 overs, their lowest total of IPL 2022. KKR have now lost seven of their first 11 matches in the tournament.

208.title: All women, children, elderly evacuated from Mariupol plant: Ukraine
208.article_body: Ukrainian Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk on Saturday announced that all women, children and elderly people have been evacuated from Mariupol's Azovstal steel plant. "This part of the Mariupol humanitarian operation is over," she said. Russian forces launched an attack on the steel plant this week, the last remaining pocket of Ukrainian resistance in the city.

209.title: PBKS' Livingstone stands outside off-stump, RR pacer Prasidh Krishna complains to umpire
209.article_body: During the second-last over of PBKS' innings in their match against RR, fast bowler Prasidh Krishna was seen complaining to the umpire after PBKS' Liam Livingstone was seen standing outside the off-stump. Krishna then bowled the first delivery from round the wicket. The umpire didn't signal it wide despite the ball being wide of the tramline.

210.title: Tajinder Bagga's arrest by Punjab Police was kidnapping: Goa CM
210.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant met BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga in Delhi and called his arrest by the Punjab Police a "kidnapping". He also said that the Punjab Police was being 'used politically' by the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP). "I commend Delhi and Haryana Police, as they stopped him in between and brought him back," Sawant added.

211.title: 6 Tamil Nadu Police personnel arrested for murder in custodial death case
211.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Police's Crime Branch-Crime Investigative Department (CB-CID) has arrested six police personnel on charges of murder in connection with the alleged custodial death of 25-year-old Vignesh. The arrests were made on the basis of the deceased's autopsy report, which indicated 13 injuries on the body. While two policemen were arrested on Friday, four others were arrested on Saturday.

212.title: Work ethic expectations from Twitter employees will be extreme: Elon Musk
212.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk tweeted "work ethic expectations would be extreme" after he completes the $44 billion acquisition of Twitter. He added that expectations from Twitter employees will be "much less than I demand of myself". Musk earlier said Twitter will be "super focussed" on software engineering, design, information security and server hardware after he acquires Twitter.

213.title: I feel I've been reborn: Man who jumped 12 ft to escape burning building in Indore
213.article_body: A 19-year-old who made a 12-foot jump to escape the fire in his building in MP's Indore said, "I feel I have got a rebirth." Tushar Badoliya Prajapati was sleeping on the terrace of a three-storey building that caught on fire leading to the death of seven people, including a couple. Prajapati thought of jumping after realising he was trapped.

214.title: Who is Putin's rumoured girlfriend Alina Kabaeva?
214.article_body: Former Russian gymnast Alina Kabaeva, rumoured to be President Vladimir Putin's girlfriend, could be targeted with EU sanctions. Alina occupies the top position at National Media Group, which has large stakes in almost all major Russian state media outlets. She's an Olympic medal-winning gymnast. There are rumours they have children together. Putin has, however, denied a relationship with her.

215.title: 3 arrested for cow slaughter in MP's Seoni, 19 kg beef seized
215.article_body: Police in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district on Friday arrested three persons who were distributing beef among themselves after allegedly killing a calf. Over 19 kg of beef was recovered from the accused along with weapons such as axes, police said. Four other accused managed to flee from the spot and a search is underway to find them, police added.

216.title: Beijing launches fresh round of mass testing to curb COVID spread
216.article_body: China's capital Beijing has launched a fresh round of mass testing of residents for COVID-19 on Saturday. The local authorities have also banned restaurant dining-in services in multiple districts and shut down more than 60 subway stations in the city in an effort to curb the spread of COVID-19. These restrictions are part of China's 'Zero-COVID' policy.

217.title: Man cremates wife after living with her dead body for 21 years in Thailand
217.article_body: A 72-year-old man in Thailand cremated his wife after living with her dead body in the same room for 21 years. "You're just going for a brief business and you'll be back home again. It won't be long, I promise," he said to his wife's remains before cremation. He revealed he has worked as a medic in Royal Thai Army.

218.title: Ronaldo's girlfriend shares pics of newborn daughter, couple name her Bella Esmeralda
218.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo's girlfriend Georgina Rodríguez took to Instagram to share pictures of their newborn daughter. Georgina revealed that they have named their daughter 'Bella Esmeralda'. She was born on April 18. Ronaldo and Georgina were expecting twins, however, their newborn son passed away. Earlier, Ronaldo had shared a picture of Bella, writing, "Forever love."

219.title: 6-yr-old girl abducted & raped by neighbour in Andhra, man arrested
219.article_body: A 20-year-old man allegedly abducted and raped a six-year-old girl in Andhra Pradesh's Anakapalle, a report said. The accused reportedly fled after committing the crime but was arrested by the police. The accused neighbour lured the minor girl when she had gone to relieve herself and took her to an abandoned place where he raped her, the report added.

220.title: Don't allow outsider to run Punjab: Anurag Thakur to CM Mann
220.article_body: Criticising the AAP government in Punjab, Union Minister Anurag Thakur asked Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann not to allow any 'outsider' to run Punjab, adding that the people would not accept it. "Punjab has given you power for reform, respect it. Respect the mandate of the people," he tweeted. Thakur's remarks came after Tajinder Bagga was arrested by the Punjab Police.

221.title: Train gets stranded for 2 hours after running over camel in MP
221.article_body: A Delhi-Bhopal Shatabdi Express train was stranded for around two hours after it ran over a camel in Madhya Pradesh's Morena district on Saturday. The train collided with the camel when it walked onto the track following which its parts got stuck in the engine, a Railway Protection Force official said. No passenger was injured in the incident, he added.

222.title: Jet Airways CEO lists 'things to avoid' for airlines after experience with foreign airline
222.article_body: Newly-appointed Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor shared a list of what airlines should avoid. It was based on his recent travel experience in Europe. "Things to avoid- 1) Staff travellers...checking in at business class counter, holding up the line. 2) Having to remind...non-smiling, no greeting agent to put priority tag. 3) Poor priority boarding process for stairs gate," he wrote.

223.title: 6 Indian nationals arrested from sinking boat while trying to illegally enter US
223.article_body: As many as six Indian nationals were arrested by US officials after they were apprehended on a sinking boat on a freezing river while allegedly trying to enter the US from Canada illegally. All the six persons apprehended were aged between 19 and 21 years and were charged with 'Improper Entry by Alien', according to reports.

224.title: 11 soldiers killed fighting terrorists near Suez Canal: Egypt
224.article_body: An Egyptian army spokesman on Saturday said that 11 soldiers were killed after clashing with a group of terrorists who attacked a water-lifting station east of the Suez Canal. "The terrorist elements are being chased and besieged in one of the isolated areas in Sinai," he added. Five others were also injured during the clash, the spokesman further said.

225.title: I'm product of pan-India home, worked in all industries: Shruti Haasan
225.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan in an interview has stated that she is a product of a pan-India home, adding that she has worked in the Hindi, Tamil and Telugu film industries. She further said that a pan-India movie has never felt like an unfathomable situation. "My dad (actor Kamal Haasan) had film premieres in Mumbai, Hyderabad and Chennai," the actress added.

226.title: BJP using political might to save a goon: Sisodia on Tajinder Bagga
226.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said that "BJP and its governments are using their political might to save a goon". Sisodia's comments come after BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga was arrested and released. Calling the BJP a "party of goons", he said that it never spoke about issues like education, health, inflation and unemployment.

227.title: Faulty battery cells caused e-scooter fires, govt probe reportedly finds
227.article_body: An initial investigation by a government agency into the recent electric scooter fires in India has found faulty battery cells and modules as the leading cause, Reuters reported. The probe reportedly looked into fire incidents involving Ola, Okinawa and Pure EV scooters. "In Ola's case, the battery cells were found to be an issue," Reuters quoted a source as saying.

228.title: Kim Sharma, Leander Paes to have court marriage: Report
228.article_body: Actress Kim Sharma and former tennis player Leander Paes will be tying the knot in a court marriage ceremony, reported The Times of India. As per the report, the couple's parents were in Mumbai at Leander's residence to discuss their wedding. The two have been in a relationship for over a year and celebrated their first anniversary on March 29.

229.title: Former Karnataka minister Pramod Madhwaraj quits Congress
229.article_body: Former Karnataka minister Pramod Madhwaraj quit the Congress party, stating that the situation in the Udupi district Congress had been a "bad experience" for him. In his resignation letter to KPCC President DK Shivakumar, he wrote that "no worthwhile steps" were taken for the redressal of his grievances. Madhwaraj served as the Minister of Fisheries in the Siddaramaiah-led government.

230.title: Video shows man shooting cigarette out of son's mouth with AK-47 in Iraq; criticised
230.article_body: A man is being criticised online after a video showed him shooting a cigarette out of his young son's mouth with what is said to be an AK-47 rifle in Iraq. The video shows the man telling the boy to hold the cigarette in his mouth before shooting it. Social media users called on local authorities to take action.

231.title: US directly involved in fighting in Ukraine: Russian lawmaker
231.article_body: Vyacheslav Volodin, the Chairman of the State Duma, on Saturday accused the US of directly participating in the conflict in Ukraine by coordinating military operations in the European country. Notably, Volodin's remark comes after US officials said that America had provided intelligence to Ukraine to help counter the Russian assault. The US has also provided military aid to Ukraine.

232.title: Sedition law needs no reconsideration: Centre asks SC to dismiss pleas against it
232.article_body: The Centre defended sedition law before Supreme Court saying that a 1962 verdict by a five-judge SC bench upholding the law is "binding, continues to be a good law and needs no reconsideration". It asked the apex court to dismiss the pleas challenging the validity of sedition, saying that a three-judge bench cannot hear a legal challenge to the law.

233.title: Stop tormenting people: WB CM to Centre on LPG cylinder price hike
233.article_body: Criticising the Centre over the LPG cylinder price hike, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee tweeted that the BJP-led central government is "tormenting" people by regularly raising the prices of essential commodities. "BJP is actually conducting a Great Indian Loot. People are being fooled," she tweeted. "Sad to see the media silent and blind", she added.

234.title: Mamata Banerjee very close to me: Sourav day after hosting Shah for dinner
234.article_body: A day after hosting Home Minister Amit Shah for dinner in Kolkata, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly on Saturday said, "Our honourable CM Mamata Banerjee is a person very close to me." Addressing the inauguration programme of a private hospital in Kolkata, Ganguly added, "I had taken the doctor who wanted to start this hospital [to her]. She immediately helped him."

235.title: Israeli soldiers demolish home of Palestinian assailant
235.article_body: The Israeli military on Saturday said that its troops had demolished the home of a Palestinian man who killed a Jewish seminary student in a shooting ambush in the occupied West Bank five months ago. Residents threw stones and firebombs at soldiers during the operation, the military added. In response, Israeli troops fired live rounds at them, it further said.

236.title: Who is Jared Birchall, who manages the world's richest man Elon Musk's wealth?
236.article_body: Jared Birchall is the Managing Director of Excession, the family office of the world's richest man Elon Musk that handles his almost $250 billion fortune. Birchall also serves various roles at the Musk Foundation, Musk's school Ad Astra and his brain-implant startup Neuralink, and several of Musk's other LLCs. He has recently helped Musk secure financing for $44-billion Twitter takeover.

237.title: My success is by-product of content-driven film: Nushrratt Bharuccha
237.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha has stated that her success is a by-product of content-driven film, adding that the audience and good content made her who she is today. "Every character that I play, is just a real character, an interesting story...Whenever I heard a script, I listen to it as an audience...The change has come from the audience's side," Nushrratt said.

238.title: He'll lose Wayanad too: Owaisi on Rahul's challenge to AIMIM, TRS
238.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has challenged Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to contest from Hyderabad and Medak in next year's Telangana Assembly elections. He said, "I'm saying...(Rahul) will now lose from Wayanad too. Come, contest from Hyderabad. Try your luck. You can contest from Medak too." This comes after Gandhi, on Friday, said he'll challenge TRS, BJP and AIMIM in Telangana.

239.title: BJP doesn't want Congress to completely disappear: Union Minister HS Puri
239.article_body: The BJP doesn't want Congress to "completely disappear", Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has said, adding, "We need an opposition." Puri said, "If we have an opposition then the opposition has to decide whether it wants to be led by Rahul Gandhi, Mamata Banerjee, Arvind Kejriwal or Sharad Pawar." The opposition needs to "get its act together", he added.

240.title: Police mustn't be used to settle political scores: Congress' Hooda
240.article_body: Criticising the Centre and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) over BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga's arrest, Congress leader Deepender Hooda said, "Police should not be used to settle political scores." He added, "The police of three states were involved. There should be tolerance." A similar case happened with Jignesh Mevani in Assam, he added.

241.title: My biggest shortcoming is 'basic shot-making': SS Rajamouli
241.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli in an interview has revealed that his biggest shortcoming is "basic shot-making" since he has not worked as an assistant director on any film. "When I made my first film 'Student No.1', I didn't know how to use a crane...I still don't know what shot exactly gives me what I need," the filmmaker added.

242.title: Rare case of monkeypox detected in UK, govt lists symptoms
242.article_body: An individual, who has recent travel history from Nigeria, has been diagnosed with monkeypox in England, said the UK government. The rare viral infection can spread when someone is in close contact with an infected person; however, there's very low risk of transmission to general population. Initial symptoms include fever, headache, muscle aches, swollen lymph nodes, chills and exhaustion.

243.title: Delhi reports 1,407 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths; positivity rate at 4.72%
243.article_body: Delhi on Saturday reported 1,407 new cases of COVID-19 and two deaths in the last 24 hours. The national capital witnessed a slight dip in the daily positivity rate, which stood at 4.72% on Saturday, compared to 5.39% on Friday. The city reported 1,546 recoveries, while 4,365 patients are under home isolation.

244.title: US First Lady Jill Biden meets Ukrainian refugees in Romania
244.article_body: During a visit to Romania on Saturday, US First Lady Jill Biden met Ukrainian women and children who had fled the war in Ukraine. She praised the Romanian government and relief organisations for the humanitarian aid they are providing to refugees. Notably, over 9 lakh Ukrainians have fled to Romania since Russia launched its invasion.

245.title: Loudspeaker issue is over in Maharashtra: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut
245.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that the loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra was over. He said, "There is peace in Maharashtra, some people were trying to spoil the situation in the state but they have been given a befitting reply." He also called upon the Centre for a policy on the usage of loudspeakers for the entire country.

246.title: Train services between Bihar's Kosi & Mithila resume after 88 yrs
246.article_body: Train services between Bihar's Kosi and Mithila, which had stopped following the 1934 earthquake, have been restored after 88 years with the launch of a passenger train between Jhanjharpur and Nirmali. The train was virtually flagged off by Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Saturday. The train services will reduce the distance between Jhanjharpur to Saharsa by about 100 km.

247.title: KL Rahul gets out for diamond duck, IPL share video
247.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul was dismissed for a diamond duck on the fifth delivery of the first over against KKR on Saturday. Rahul got run out for 0(0) after a direct hit by KKR captain Shreyas Iyer. Rahul was sent back to the non-striker's end by Quinton De Kock who initially set off for a quick single.

248.title: Woman robbed of jewellery worth ₹1.2 lakh in Maha by 4 posing as policemen
248.article_body: Four unidentified persons allegedly robbed a 60-year-old woman of her jewellery worth ₹1.2 lakh in Maharashtra. The victim was travelling in an autorickshaw when the accused riding sports bikes intercepted her and flashed a fake identity card, posing as police personnel. The accused allegedly asked her to keep her jewellery safely in a packet and offered to help her pack.

249.title: Man dies after TN bar server beats him for throwing food on floor
249.article_body: A 35-year-old man died after a Tasmac bar attendant allegedly beat him following a quarrel about throwing food on the bar's floor in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Thursday. The victim "fainted and fell on the floor" after the incident and was taken to hospital for treatment, police said. He was then dropped at his house but he, however, died later.

250.title: BJP-RSS trying to rekindle 90s' era of hatred: Owaisi on Gyanvapi mosque survey
250.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday criticised a Varanasi court's order allowing survey of some sections of Gyanvapi mosque. Owaisi also accused the BJP-RSS of rekindling "the era of hatred as the one in the 90s". "This order to survey the masjid is an open violation of Places of Worship Act 1991, which prohibits conversion of religious places," Owaisi added.

251.title: Never a choice, I admire her holistically: Palak on her standing by mom Shweta
251.article_body: Actress Palak Tiwari, speaking about standing by her mother actress Shweta Tiwari's side, stated that it was never a choice. She said that the only person she's admired holistically is her mother, adding she always prioritised the well-being of their family. "For me, she could do no wrong then and she could do no wrong now," Palak said.

252.title: It breaks my heart: Depp's ex-fiancee amid defamation trial with Heard
252.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-fiancee Jennifer Grey has spoken about his ongoing defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, saying it breaks her heart "for everybody involved". Jennifer added, "I just think it's sad and I wish it was resolved and I just wish everybody well." Depp has sued Heard following her 2018 op-ed piece about being a victim of domestic violence.

253.title: 25,000 litres of chemical used to make spurious liquor seized in MP
253.article_body: A tanker filled with around 25,000 litres of overproof chemical, which is commonly used for preparing spurious liquor, was seized from a warehouse in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri on the intervening night of Thursday and Friday. The chemical is reportedly worth around ₹5 crore. Police have booked two people associated with the inter-state liquor peddler group under provisions of Excise Act.

254.title: 3 Goa I-T officers sexually assault & threaten woman staff, booked
254.article_body: Three Income Tax inspectors in Goa's Panaji, who allegedly sexually assaulted a female staff, have been booked, police said, adding, they are yet to be arrested. Two of them had also threatened the victim to delete WhatsApp messages while the third outraged her modesty, police added. Police are investigating further and have sought CCTV footage from the Income Tax office.

255.title: 4 cheat MP villagers of ₹5 lakh using biometric machines, arrested
255.article_body: Cyber police in MP have arrested four persons for cheating over 30 villagers of ₹5 lakh using biometric machines. According to police, the gang's kingpin organised camps to prepare Ayushman cards, etc, and the accused helped villagers in opening bank accounts. They, however, stored their digital information in an application and later used it to siphon money from villagers' accounts.

256.title: Who is IAS officer Pooja Singhal, being investigated in ₹18 cr fraud in J'khand?
256.article_body: Jharkhand Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal is being investigated by ED in a money laundering case linked to alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds. The 2000 batch IAS officer had reportedly cleared UPSC at 21 and was the Agriculture Secretary in the previous BJP government. She's been accused of financial irregularities during her tenure as Deputy Commissioner of three different districts.

257.title: 2 workers killed, 3 injured in accident at Tidong Hydropower Project in Himachal
257.article_body: Two workers died and three others sustained injuries in a major accident at Tidong Hydropower Project in Himachal Pradesh's Kinnaur on Saturday morning. As per information, the five workers were travelling in a trolley inside the tunnel when it reportedly slipped off from the track and fell deep inside. ITBP personnel rescued the three injured workers trapped inside the tunnel.

258.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature today released
258.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) released a list of cities that recorded 42°C or more as their maximum temperature on Saturday. Rajasthan's Barmer recorded the highest maximum temperature at 45°C, followed by Phalodi (44.6°C). Both Bikaner and Maharashtra's Jalgaon recorded maximum temperature of 44.5°C. A maximum temperature of 44.4°C was recorded in Jaisalmer.

259.title: Diplomats express concern over state of emergency in Sri Lanka
259.article_body: Diplomats and rights groups on Saturday raised their concerns over a state of emergency imposed by Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa in the country. Under the emergency regulations, Rajapaksa can authorise detentions, seize possession of property and search any premises. Notably, this comes after protests erupted against him over the handling of the economic crisis in the country.

260.title: RR record their first successful chase in IPL 2022, end their 2-match losing streak
260.article_body: RR chased down the target of 190 runs in 19.4 overs against PBKS to record their first successful run chase in IPL 2022. With the victory, RR ended their two-match losing streak. Yashasvi Jaiswal top-scored for RR with 68(41), while their leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal registered bowling figures of 4-0-28-3.

261.title: Bag maker ESBEDA fined ₹38,000 for charging customer ₹20 for its carry bag in Mumbai
261.article_body: A Mumbai District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has fined bag maker ESBEDA for charging a customer ₹20 for its carry bag in 2019, which was branded with the company's logo. The commission asked the company to pay the customer ₹13,000 towards litigation expenses and compensation. Moreover, it was asked to deposit ₹25,000 with the consumer welfare fund.

262.title: Anonymity is an 'inherent risk' in use of blockchain tech: FM Sitharaman
262.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said anonymity is an "inherent risk" in use of blockchain technology and urged people to take precaution in future with a rise in the use of this technology. Calling distributed ledger technology (DLT) "beautiful", she added, "Unless we...guard ourselves against that anonymous element...we'll be exposing ourselves much more than...we would've imagined."

263.title: 'Got a call saying I'm laid off,' says woman days before she was due to join Meta
263.article_body: In a widely-shared LinkedIn post, Stephanie Washington, who was hired as a Recruiting Coordinator for Meta, said she was laid off just days before she was due to join the workplace. "I just signed...apartment lease 15 minutes before my manager called me...They are only compensating us for six weeks of pay after a month-long process of interviews," she wrote.

264.title: Railway staff risks life to restart train on bridge as passenger pulls alarm chain
264.article_body: Railways Ministry shared a video of an employee risking his life to restart a train that was halted over a river bridge after a passenger pulled the alarm chain. The video shows Central Railways' Assistant Loco Pilot Satish Kumar resetting Godan Express' alarm chain by going under it. "Pulling the...chain for no reason can cause trouble to many," said Railways.

265.title: Govt aims to set up vehicle scrapyards within 150 kms of city centres
265.article_body: The government aims to develop at least one automobile scrapping facility within 150 kilometres of each city centre, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said on Saturday. India has the potential to become vehicle scrapping hub of South Asia, Gadkari added. The National Automobile Scrappage Policy allows all types and sizes of investors to come and establish scrapping centres, he further said.

266.title: KKR to bowl first against LSG, both teams make one change each
266.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against LSG. Both the sides have made one change each. Harshit Rana has replaced Umesh Yadav in KKR's playing XI, while Avesh Khan has replaced Krishnappa Gowtham in LSG's playing XI. LSG are currently second on the IPL 2022 points table, while KKR are placed eighth.

267.title: 5 dead, 1 critical as vehicle crashes into truck from behind in Maharashtra
267.article_body: Five persons were killed, while a two-year-old girl had a miraculous escape, when a speeding multi-utility vehicle rammed into a truck from behind in Maharashtra, a police officer said. Another person was left critically injured in the incident, the officer added. The accident took place when the vehicle was on its way towards Nagpur from Umred.

268.title: I wasn't treated properly, didn't get the respect I deserved: Chris Gayle on snubbing IPL
268.article_body: Talking about not giving his name for IPL mega auction earlier this year, Chris Gayle said, "For the last couple of years...the way the IPL went about, I felt...I wasn't treated properly." He added he didn't get the respect he deserved after doing "so much" for the sport and IPL. Notably, Gayle had pulled out of IPL 2021 mid-way.

269.title: Mumbai chicken delivery boy arrested for molesting 3 persons, including minor girl
269.article_body: Police, while questioning a 24-year-old youth arrested in a molestation case, found that two previous cases of molestation were registered against him, including one involving a minor girl. In one case, the accused, a Mumbai-based chicken delivery boy, had reportedly tried to enter the complainant's house after delivering chicken and kept staring at her and tried to open her door.

270.title: Sex racket running through secret door in toilet busted in K'taka; woman seen coming out
270.article_body: A prostitution racket which was running through a small secret door inside a toilet has been busted, with Chitradurga police arresting three people in Karnataka. The accused used the secret door to let in the "customers", according to reports. A video has also surfaced showing a woman coming out of the door.

271.title: John Mulaney told me to spread 'Kanye has polio' rumours: Pete
271.article_body: Comedian Pete Davidson has revealed that John Mulaney told him to spread the rumour that his girlfriend Kim Kardashian's ex-husband rapper Kanye West has polio. As per reports, Kanye had spread rumours in January that Pete is a gay man who contracted AIDS. "AIDS is such an old-school-like thing...It's just such a '90s, early 2000s thing to [come at me]."

272.title: Dave Chappelle getting a** whipped needed to happen: Kevin Hart
272.article_body: Comedian Kevin has reacted to comedian Dave Chappelle being attacked onstage during his show, saying that it "needed to happen". "Somebody getting their ass whipped sends a message out to the other people," Kevin added. He further said that there are "a lot of lines that have gotten blurred" and people shouldn't continue to think they can "break the barrier".

273.title: I was 110kg & wanted to act, relatives said someone did witchcraft: Manoj
273.article_body: Actor Manoj Pahwa has revealed that ahead of his acting debut, his relatives said "someone has done some kind of witchcraft" on him as he was "110 kg overweight and [wants] to become a hero". Manoj further said that he was labelled a comedian and "got frustrated" with the film roles he was offered before 'Article 15' and 'Mulk'.

274.title: Rare tornado witnessed in Assam, video goes viral
274.article_body: A low-intensity tornado was captured in videos in a village in Assam's Barpeta on Saturday. The tornado, a rare occurrence in these parts, is seen tearing through a field and some huts in the video. Locals said they saw a clear swirling column of air carrying dust and debris. There were no immediate reports of loss of life or property.

275.title: CBI searches premises of Punjab AAP MLA Jaswant in ₹40 crore bank fraud case
275.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) is carrying out searches at the premises of AAP MLA Jaswant Singh Gajjan Majra in an alleged ₹40 crore bank fraud case, officials said on Saturday. The searches are being conducted at three locations in Sangrur, including the Malerkotla area, which is the ancestral home of the Amargarh MLA, officials added.

276.title: Punjab court issues fresh arrest warrant against BJP's Bagga a day after release
276.article_body: A Mohali court on Saturday issued fresh warrants for BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga's arrest, a day after he was released from Punjab Police's custody and brought back to Delhi. The court instructed the police to produce Bagga before it. Bagga was arrested on Friday for allegedly making provocative statements and 'threatening' AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal during a protest.

277.title: Supreme Court gets 2 more judges, set to regain full strength of 34
277.article_body: The Supreme Court is set to regain its full strength of 34 judges with two appointments to the top court on Saturday. The Union Law Ministry announced Gauhati High Court Chief Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia and Gujarat High Court Justice JB Pardiwala's appointments in separate notifications. This comes days after the Supreme Court Collegium recommended the names for elevation to SC.

278.title: Pic of notice on separate lift for 'house maids' in Pune society sparks debate
278.article_body: A notice asking domestic helps and service personnel to use only the lift assigned to them in a Pune housing society has sparked a debate on Twitter. "It's less about the so-called maintenance, it's more about the 'mental comfort' of the orthodox residents," a user said. Some people argued that separate lift was assigned because workers stopped on every floor.

279.title: ₹2.65 lakh cr spent on projects in Northeast from 2014-2021: Govt
279.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Friday said that more than ₹2.65 lakh crore had been spent on various infrastructure projects in the Northeast from 2014 to 2021. "The result of which is visible in...form of development," he added. Separately, Rai also said that there's been a vast improvement in the security situation in the Northeast.

280.title: KT Rama Rao reviews Hyderabad civic body's development projects
280.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao reviewed development projects undertaken by Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) and other departments and advised authorities to complete the monsoon season plan. Officials said that the minister took stock of the progress of the construction of link roads in Hyderabad, the strategic canal development programme and the construction of Hyderabad roads.

281.title: Police raid gambling den in Hyderabad, 9 arrested
281.article_body: The Rachakonda Police said that nine people have been arrested on charges of gambling. Playing cards and cash were also seized from the accused, the police said. "The LB Nagar Police nabbed Gaming Act offenders, seized one cell phone, 27 playing cards, and net cash of ₹7,980," Rachakonda Police added.

282.title: We don't support murderers: Owaisi on murder of man by wife's relatives in Hyd
282.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has condemned the killing of 25-year-old Hindu man Nagaraju, who was allegedly lynched by his Muslim wife's relatives over their marriage on a busy road in Hyderabad. Owaisi added that the woman had married willingly and her family had no right to kill her husband. "We do not support murderers," Owaisi further said.

283.title: Baseless and untrue: ED as Xiaomi alleges it threatened staff with 'violence'
283.article_body: After Xiaomi alleged in a court filing that its top executives faced threats of "physical violence" during a probe by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), the agency responded saying that the claims are "untrue and baseless". The ED said that "there was no coercion or threat to the officers of the company" and that they deposed their statements before ED voluntarily.

284.title: Aditi Rao Hydari to make her debut at 75th Cannes Film Festival
284.article_body: Aditi Rao Hydari will be making her debut at the 75th Cannes Film Festival this year. The actress will be representing smartphone brand Vivo India at the festival. "As an artist, being a part of a prestigious institution that celebrates cinema is an exhilarating feeling," Aditi said. Notably, Deepika Padukone will also attend the festival as a jury member.

285.title: Abhishek in talks for John's 'Ayyappanum...' remake after Arjun's exit: Report
285.article_body: Arjun Kapoor has reportedly opted out of the Hindi remake of the Malayalam film 'Ayyappanum Koshiyum'. Abhishek Bachchan, who had earlier stepped away from the film, is in advanced talks with the makers to portray Prithviraj Sukumaran's character Koshi Kurian in the remake, as per the report. The upcoming film will be directed by 'Mission Mangal' director Jagan Shakti.

286.title: Rahul Gandhi meets jailed NSUI students in Hyderabad
286.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi met 18 NSUI members in Hyderabad's Chanchalguda Central Jail who were detained for protesting against Osmania University's administration for not giving permission for Gandhi's event on the campus. Gandhi, who is on a two-day visit to Telangana, tweeted, "The soul of the Congress is its dedicated workers, who are waging a selfless battle against injustice."

287.title: Emmanuel Macron sworn in as French President for second term
287.article_body: Emmanuel Macron was on Saturday sworn in as President of France for a second term at a ceremony at the Elysee Palace, followed by the firing of canons at the Invalides gardens. Macron said his second term would be "new" and not merely a continuation of the first. Macron had defeated far-right rival Marine Le Pen to win the election.

288.title: Harry, Meghan will not appear on palace balcony during Queen's Jubilee
288.article_body: UK's Prince Harry, his wife Meghan Markle and Prince Andrew will not appear on the Buckingham Palace balcony as part of the opening celebrations for Queen Elizabeth II's Platinum Jubilee. The Queen will be joined on June 2 only by "members of...Royal Family who're currently undertaking official public duties", Buckingham Palace said, adding the decision was taken after "careful consideration".

289.title: Has he vanished into thin air?: SC to UP on missing 82-yr-old COVID-19 patient
289.article_body: The Supreme Court has criticised the Uttar Pradesh Police and state government over their inability to trace an 82-year-old COVID-19 patient, who went missing from a hospital in Prayagraj over a year ago. "How can a person, who was finding it difficult to walk, vanish into thin air?" the SC observed. The matter will now be heard after four weeks.

290.title: Took a while for me to get comfortable in my own skin: Samantha
290.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu stated that it took her a while to get comfortable in her own skin and now, she is much more confident in trying out different roles which she wouldn't have had the courage to do in past. "I believe after working on so many projects, I can say that I'm a lot more confident," Samantha said.

291.title: Kashyap's daughter reveals her Instagram account was hacked, says 'so scary'
291.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap's daughter and YouTuber Aaliyah Kashyap took to Instagram Stories on Saturday to inform her fans and followers that her account was hacked. "My account was hacked. So scary I want to die," she wrote. "Please ignore whatever was posted or if you got any messages or anything weird," Aaliyah added.

292.title: Dhawan's an IPL legend, not discussed as much as other players: Harbhajan
292.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan is not discussed as much as other players, with some players given "too much" attention. "Dhawan is an IPL legend. He has scored runs against all the opposition and proved himself," added Harbhajan. "Dhawan deserves praise as he has scored over 6,000 runs in IPL," stated Harbhajan.

293.title: Babar is better than Kohli, Shaheen better than Bumrah: Aaqib Javed
293.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed has said that Pakistan skipper Babar Azam is better than Virat Kohli while pacer Shaheen Afridi is better than India's Jasprit Bumrah. "Now I think Babar is ahead. He [Kohli] had his peak but now going down," Javed said. "I now think that Shaheen is better than Bumrah...(He) has more capacity than Bumrah," Javed added.

294.title: Andhra HC sentences 3 IAS officers to 1 month of jail for contempt of court
294.article_body: Andhra Pradesh High Court on Friday sentenced three IAS officers to one month of jail for contempt of court. In October 2019, the court had directed the officials to consider and pass an order on the candidature of a petitioner to the post of Village Agriculture Assistant (Grade-2) within two weeks, which the officers failed to implement.

295.title: Odisha puts 175 fire units on high alert, cancels officers' leaves ahead of cyclone
295.article_body: In view of a cyclonic storm over east-central Bay of Bengal by May 8, the Odisha government has put 175 fire units on high alert and also cancelled leaves of officers. Odisha Fire Services Director General SK Upadhyay has informed that the southern districts are more vulnerable to the storm, which is expected to hit the state on May 10.

296.title: Fake notice saying NEET PG 2022 postponed posted online, no delay in exam: Govt
296.article_body: The Centre has warned about a fake notice claiming that the NEET PG 2022 exam has been postponed to July 9, saying, "The exam hasn't been postponed." It added, "It will be conducted on 21 May only...Don't be misled by such unverified notices." The fake notice was issued in the name of National Board of Examinations.

297.title: Amazon driver leaves 'kind' message for girl fighting cancer in US, Bezos reacts
297.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos took to Instagram Stories to share the story of Amazon driver Asani Anderson who left a message for an 8-year-old girl battling cancer in US while dropping off packages. "Amazon is praying 4 Aubrey luv you!" the message by Anderson read. Reacting to the gesture, Bezos wrote on Instagram, "Kindness makes our world better...Anderson embodies it."

298.title: UP minister bathes with hand pump water at supporter's home, says 'No VIP culture'
298.article_body: Uttar Pradesh minister Nand Gopal Gupta 'Nandi' posted a video of himself bathing in hand pump water after staying the night at a party worker's home. "This is the difference between...Yogi government and previous governments. In Yogi Sarkar, there's no distance and difference between the common man and the government," he tweeted. "There is no VIP culture," he added.

299.title: They want to see a crying widow: Neetu on being trolled post Rishi's death
299.article_body: Neetu Kapoor, in an interview, opened up on getting trolled for being more active on social media after Rishi Kapoor's demise. Neetu said, "There are some who say things like 'her husband is dead and she is enjoying'. They want to see that crying widow type." "I just block them," she said, adding there is nothing wrong with being happy.

300.title: Brisbane Olympics 2032 is a big event for whole Pacific region: IOC Prez
300.article_body: International Olympic Committee President Thomas Bach has said that the Brisbane Olympics 2032 is a big event for the "whole Pacific region". "I can say because I have been travelling in the meantime in the Pacific," Bach said. "But what is important...it's everywhere, it's great anticipation of these (Olympic) Games. They are all excited, they are all motivated," Bach added.

301.title: Apple China plant workers clash with guards over COVID-19 lockdowns
301.article_body: Hundreds of Apple Shanghai plant workers clashed with guards on Thursday after weeks at the plant under COVID-19 lockdown. The factory, owned by Taiwan's Quanta, has been operating under tight restrictions since the beginning of April. The employees are reportedly worried about positive COVID-19 cases on the campus. Tensions broke after workers tried to return to dormitories after their shifts.

302.title: Hamilton wears 3 watches, 8 rings, 4 necklaces in protest of F1's jewellery ban, pic viral
302.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton attended a press conference ahead of the Miami Grand Prix wearing three watches, eight rings, four necklaces and two earrings. It was in a protest of F1's ruling which bars drivers from wearing jewellery while racing. "I feel like it's almost like a step backwards," Hamilton said.

303.title: Beyond proud of you: Shibani as Farhan gets cast in MCU's 'Ms Marvel'
303.article_body: Shibani Dandekar took to Instagram on Saturday to confirm her actor-husband Farhan Akhtar's participation in Marvel Studios' upcoming web series 'Ms Marvel'. "Can't wait for this one!! First mainstream leading Indian actor to be part of the Marvel Universe! Beyond proud of you, Farhan," she wrote. Farhan also confirmed the news on his Instagram handle on Saturday.

304.title: My father inspired my character in 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar': Ranveer Singh
304.article_body: Ranveer Singh, in a recent interview, revealed that his father Jagjit Singh Bhavnani was his inspiration for his character in 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'. The actor said, "[My father] would pour everything in the endeavour of giving us a better life which is the premise of Jayeshbhai's journey as well." Ranveer added that he now has a deeper appreciation for his father.

305.title: Russia claims to have destroyed stockpile of western weapons in Ukraine
305.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry on Saturday said its forces have destroyed a large stockpile of military equipment from the US and European countries near the Bohodukhiv railway station in Ukraine's Kharkiv region. The ministry also said it had hit 18 Ukrainian military facilities overnight, including three ammunition depots in Dachne. Russia has warned the West against sending more weapons to Ukraine.

306.title: US First Lady brings 5 gallons of ketchup for US troops deployed to Romania
306.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden brought five gallons of ketchup for US troops deployed to Romania. Ketchup was in short supply on the Mihail Kogalniceanu Air Base. The base is temporarily home to about 1,600 of the several thousand troops US President Joe Biden deployed to Eastern Europe in the leadup to the Russia-Ukraine war.

307.title: 5 held for terrorising villagers with weapons like sword, axe in Thane
307.article_body: Five people, including a woman, were arrested for allegedly terrorising residents of Dahisar Mori and Thakurpada villages in Thane, police said. "Between 12:15 am and 3:45 am on Friday, the accused moved around...carrying swords, choppers and axes...and terrorising...residents. They banged the doors of several houses and threatened the residents for no valid reason," police added.

308.title: Massive fire breaks out at Tata Steel plant in Jamshedpur, 3 workers injured
308.article_body: A massive fire broke out in a coke plant at the Tata Steel factory in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur due to an alleged blast in a battery on Saturday. Three contractual employees sustained minor injuries in the incident and were administered first aid, according to an official statement. Five fire tenders immediately rushed to the spot and brought the situation under control.

309.title: Rajnath calls for border development, says Chinese presence 'increased'
309.article_body: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has called for the development of border areas and urged Border Roads Organisation to increase its capability by using technology for infrastructure development. Chinese presence has increased in the Northern sector as they use their "proficiency in construction in mountainous areas" to reach places "quickly", he said. "BRO must...work in parallel," he added.

310.title: Tata Group Chairman buys house he was living on rent for 5 yrs for ₹98 crore
310.article_body: Tata Group Chairman N Chandrasekaran and his family have purchased a duplex worth ₹98 crore in Mumbai's Pedder Road. The family had been residing in the duplex on lease for the last five years. Situated on the 11th and 12th floor of a 28-storey building, the family has reportedly been paying a monthly rent of ₹20 lakh for that house.

311.title: Actress Nayanthara, director Vignesh Shivan to tie the knot on June 9: Report
311.article_body: Actress Nayanthara, who predominantly appears in Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam cinema, is set to tie the knot with director Vignesh Shivan on June 9, as per reports. The duo will get married at Tirumala Tirupati temple in Andhra Pradesh in the presence of family members and close friends, reports said. Nayanthara got engaged to Vignesh in 2021.

312.title: Rahul plays with the mind of the bowlers and traps them: Suresh Raina
312.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina said LSG captain KL Rahul is in the "best" phase of his career, adding that he is playing some amazing shots. "Rahul plays with the mind of the bowlers and traps them. He forces the bowlers to bowl in the areas which are his strong zones and constructs his innings accordingly," stated Raina.

313.title: Pune city records decline in maximum temperature: Report
313.article_body: The maximum temperature in Pune city has been recorded at normal levels on Friday, with the night temperature dropping to 19°C, according to a report. The weather in the city is likely to remain pleasant over the next few days, weather department officials said. Notably, the temperature remained high in other parts of Maharashtra.

314.title: 3 more arrested by Delhi Police in Jahangirpuri violence case
314.article_body: Delhi Police arrested three more accused in connection with the communal clashes that broke out in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on April 16, officials said on Saturday. One accused was seen brandishing a pistol in CCTV footage, an official said. The other two were "actively" involved in the clashes, the official added. A total of 36 people have been arrested so far.

315.title: Sharda University responds after 'Nazism, Hindu right wing similarities' question in exam
315.article_body: Sharda University has responded after its BA Political Science question paper asked students about similarities between "fascism/Nazism and Hindu right wing (Hindutva)". The university said it has constituted a three-member committee to look into the possibility of bias in the questions, adding that the concerned faculty has been suspended, pending inquiry. It expressed regret over the incident.

316.title: Deforestation in Brazilian Amazon breaks all records for April
316.article_body: Deforestation seen in Brazilian Amazon broke all records for April, corresponding to more than 1,000 square kilometres. The figure is the highest seen in seven years of record-keeping and 74% more than the same month in 2021, which was the prior record. It's the first time that deforestation alerts have surpassed 1,000 square kilometres during a month in rainy season.

317.title: Delhi Metro announces new interchange hub at RK Ashram Marg metro station
317.article_body: A new interchange hub will be constructed at central Delhi's RK Ashram Marg metro station, DMRC announced. "RK Ashram Marg station on Blue Line is being converted into an interchange. It will be connecting RK Ashram Marg station of Magenta Line," the DMRC said. "Commuters will have access to alternate & shorter routes from Central to North Delhi," DMRC added.

318.title: Toxic gas inside a well claims lives of 2 fishermen in Jharkhand
318.article_body: Two fishermen died after inhaling toxic gas inside a well at Bhusahi village in Jharkhand's Palamu district. The deceased, identified as Patali Singh (37) and Ramchandra Choudhary (40), had gone inside the 30-feet deep well to catch fish, police said. Notably, the bodies have been recovered and sent to the Medinirai Medical College and Hospital for postmortem.

319.title: Raid at IAS officer's CA's home reveals ₹17 crore in cash in J'khand, video viral
319.article_body: A viral video has shown hordes of cash discovered during a raid at the house of a CA linked to Jharkhand Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal. The raid by Enforcement Directorate officials on Friday was carried out in connection with the alleged diversion of MGNREGA funds. Over ₹17 crores were recovered during the raid at the Ranchi-based CA's house.

320.title: Don't know how Miller couldn't connect any ball in final over vs MI: Sehwag
320.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said he cannot understand how GT batter David Miller failed to connect any ball in the final over of his team's chase against MI, with GT defeated by five runs. "The bowling...was not that special that [it] prevented them from scoring those nine runs. The last two balls did not even touch Miller's bat," added Sehwag.

321.title: Fascinating why a player of his class was left out: Vettori on MI's David
321.article_body: Reacting to MI all-rounder Tim David's 44* off 21 balls against GT, ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori said, "Not one ball did he slog." "It would be fascinating to understand why a player of his class was left out," added Vettori. "You...don't see such clean hitting with such pure shot making at the back end of an IPL innings," stated Vettori.

322.title: Woman raped for 79 days by tantrik in Odisha, rescued by police
322.article_body: A married woman was allegedly raped repeatedly by a 'tantrik' while being on his premises for 79 days in Baleswar, Odisha. The woman was repeatedly raped by the accused in front of the former's 2.5 years old son, police said after rescuing them. Notably, the survivor has named her husband and in-laws as well in the FIR.

323.title: Before 'Gully Boy', it felt like 'jackpot' to get any film: Vijay Varma
323.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma said things have changed for him post 'Gully Boy' as before that, it felt like a 'jackpot' to get any film. The actor added that choosing the right script has become more difficult now "because you are spoilt for options". "You have to decide which ones you can carry on your shoulder," Varma said.

324.title: Global bird populations steadily declining: Study
324.article_body: According to a study, the population of birds worldwide is declining rapidly. Approximately 48% of existing bird species are known or suspected to be undergoing population decline, 39% are stable, and only 6% are showing an increase in population. The key threats leading to this decline are loss and degradation of natural habitats, direct overexploitation of species and climate change.

325.title: Registrations begin for Sony TV's Shark Tank India season 2
325.article_body: After a successful first season and investing Rs. 42 crore across 67 businesses, Sony TV has opened registrations for Shark Tank India season 2. Whether you are a home entrepreneur, business owner, start-up or just have a business idea, here's your chance to realise your business dream and scale it. Download or update Sony Liv to register now

326.title: A week's break from social media improves mental well-being: Study
326.article_body: As per new research, taking a week's break from social media not only improves an individual's overall well-being but also reduces symptoms of depression and anxiety. "Social media is a part of life...But if you are spending hours each week scrolling...it's negatively impacting you," researchers said. "Many of our participants reported positive effects from being off social media," they added.

327.title: Tim David finished things really well: Rohit after win over GT
327.article_body: After MI batter Tim David scored 44*(21) against GT, which helped MI secure their second win of IPL 2022, skipper Rohit Sharma has said that the Singaporean batter finished their innings "really well". Notably, David was dropped from MI's playing XI after just two games. Since his comeback, David has played unbeaten knocks in both victories of MI this season.

328.title: Warrant issued against wife of Mamata Banerjee's nephew in WB coal scam case
328.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday issued a bailable warrant against Rujira Banerjee, wife of TMC General Secretary and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek Banerjee, after the Enforcement Directorate (ED) claimed she failed to appear before it despite multiple summons. Abhishek and Rujira have been named as accused in a money laundering case linked to an alleged coal scam.

329.title: Depp's supporters claim Amber Heard posed for photo while crying in court, video surfaces
329.article_body: Actress Amber Heard broke down in court as she testified against her ex-husband, actor Johnny Depp during the ongoing defamation trial. She can be seen wiping her nose with a tissue and then appears to be posing for the media for a few seconds, claimed social media users. Several Twitter users shared videos while alleging that she posed for photos.

330.title: Twitter CEO's wife is General Partner at VC firm backing Musk's Twitter deal
330.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal's wife Vineeta Agarwala is a General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz, the venture capital (VC) firm that has agreed to invest $400 million in Elon Musk's Twitter takeover deal. Vineeta leads investments for Andreessen Horowitz's biotech and medical fund. As per reports, Musk is expected to serve as the temporary Twitter CEO after he completes the takeover.

331.title: Bowlers took us over the line: MI's Tim David after win over GT
331.article_body: Mumbai Indians batter Tim David has said that bowlers got Mumbai Indians "over the line" in the match against Gujarat Titans, which the former won by 5 runs. "It was a good batting wicket...Shows how well our bowlers bowled in the second half to get us over the line," said the 26-year-old Singaporean cricketer.

332.title: NVIDIA to pay $5.5 million penalty over cryptomining disclosures
332.article_body: NVIDIA has agreed to pay $5.5 million to settle civil charges that it did not properly disclose the impact of cryptomining on its gaming business. In consecutive quarters in FY 2018, NVIDIA failed to reveal that cryptomining was a "significant element" of its revenue growth from sales of chips designed for gaming. NVIDIA did not admit or deny the findings.

333.title: I hope both work at box office: Kartik on 'Bhool...' & 'Dhaakad' clash
333.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan opened up about the box office clash between his upcoming horror-comedy 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and Kangana Ranaut-starrer action film 'Dhaakad'. Stating that both the films belong to very different genres, Kartik said, "On May 20, the moviegoers would have the option to watch 2 films. I hope both (Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 and Dhaakad) work at box office."

334.title: Shaab is back with gift of LPG price: Pawan Khera on PM Modi's Europe tour
334.article_body: Congress' Pawan Khera criticised BJP government for surge in price of LPG cylinders and said that "shaab (PM Narendra Modi) is back after 65 hours, 60 photoshoots across three countries with this gift of LPG price." He said, "Today a situation is created where people have to surrender LPG cylinders." The LPG cylinder price has been increased by ₹50 today.

335.title: 4 booked for assaulting woman, minor son in Pimpri Chinchwad
335.article_body: A  female shop owner and three others were booked for physically assaulting a female tenant and her minor son in a dispute about rent in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad, the police said on Friday. The boy was attacked with a hammer for filming the attack on his mother, an official said. The police have registered a case and initiated a probe.

336.title: Man killed by wife's relatives in Hyd sold gold chain to take her Eid shopping
336.article_body: A 25-year-old Hindu man who was allegedly killed by his Muslim wife's relatives in Hyderabad over their marriage had sold his gold chain to take her Eid shopping, the man's colleague said. The HR manager at the car showroom that employed Nagaraju said the latter had sold his chain for ₹25,000. Nagaraju was stabbed to death on a busy road.

337.title: I walked out of shower and someone asked me for picture: Ileana
337.article_body: Actress Ileana D'Cruz in an interview has revealed that recently she walked out of the shower and someone asked her for a picture. The actress added that she was dressed but her hair was wet and she wasn't expecting to bump into someone. "I used to be a lot more reserved about things like that but...I indulge now," she said.

338.title: Fascinating why a player of his class was left out: Vettori on MI's David
338.article_body: Reacting to MI all-rounder Tim David's 44* off 21 balls against GT, ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori said, "Not one ball did he slog." "It would be fascinating to understand why a player of his class was left out," added Vettori. "You...don't see such clean hitting with such pure shot making at the back end of an IPL innings," stated Vettori.

339.title: PBKS to bat first as RR lose toss for 10th time in IPL 2022, playing XIs announced
339.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal won the toss and elected to bat first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. It is the 10th time in 11 IPL 2022 matches that RR captain Sanju Samson lost the toss. PBKS are fielding an unchanged side, while Yashasvi Jaiswal has replaced Karun Nair in RR's playing XI.

340.title: Berlin bans Russian & Ukrainian flags during WWII commemoration
340.article_body: Berlin authorities have banned Russian and Ukrainian flags from being flown near the German city's memorials and monuments this weekend as the country commemorates the 77th anniversary of the end of World War II. Berlin police warned that it'll take action "against any form of support, approval, or even glorification of Russia's war of aggression on Ukraine, especially in gatherings".

341.title: Man booked under UAPA gets 7 yrs in jail after he accepts guilt in Mumbai
341.article_body: A Mumbai court sentenced a 39-year-old man, booked under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA), to seven years in jail after he accepted his guilt. He has been convicted for his links to ISIS. "The man was allegedly planning to assist an ISIS member in making explosives to cause a blast during the month of Ramzan," as per NIA.

342.title: Taliban makes covering face in public must for women, says all-covering burqa is best
342.article_body: Taliban on Saturday ruled that Afghan women must cover their faces in public, according to a decree from the group's supreme leader Hibatullah Akhundzada. The decree stated that the ideal face covering was the all-covering blue burqa. A Taliban spokesperson said a woman's father or closest male relative could be imprisoned if she didn't cover her face outside the home.

343.title: Musk didn't have plan for Twitter: CEO of Binance which is investing $500 mn in buyout
343.article_body: Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao told Financial Times that the cryptocurrency exchange's $500 million investment to help Elon Musk acquire Twitter is "more of a blank cheque". He said, "[Musk] didn't have a plan for Twitter. There isn't...a business plan." Zhao further said, "After the investment...Elon will figure out what he wants to do, and we'll be supportive of that."

344.title: Was called a 'stick' in South industry, asked to lose weight in Mumbai: Rakul
344.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh revealed that she was asked to put on some weight in the South film industry. "When I debuted, I was told I'm too thin...People would call me 'stick' and I'd say 'no'...But after two-three years I gave in," she said. Rakul added when she came to Mumbai to work in Bollywood, she was asked to lose weight.

345.title: Don't know how Miller couldn't connect any ball in final over vs MI: Sehwag
345.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said he cannot understand how GT batter David Miller failed to connect any ball in the final over of his team's chase against MI, with GT defeated by five runs. "The bowling...was not that special that [it] prevented them from scoring those nine runs. The last two balls did not even touch Miller's bat," added Sehwag.

346.title: PNB hikes interest rates on select term deposits by up to 60 bps
346.article_body: Punjab National Bank (PNB) will increase interest rates on term deposits in selected buckets by up to 60 basis points with effect from today. It has also increased the repo-linked lending rate (RLLR) from 6.5% to 6.9% with effect from June 1 for existing customers. The move comes after several banks raised interest rates following the RBI's repo rate hike.

347.title: Directors have manipulated, taken advantage of me: Abhay Deol
347.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol has revealed that he has been manipulated, taken advantage of and gaslit by directors he worked with. "There are directors who don't have your best interests at heart and are just using you to get ahead in life," he added. Abhay further said that he had to experience it otherwise he would have been naive and idealistic.

348.title: I was called unprofessional, they won't say that about superstars: Bobby
348.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has revealed he was called unprofessional without basis, adding he never cancelled a shoot and has never been late. "Nobody says anything about [superstars] because they have a market. But when there are people...who have a limited market, people jump at you at the first opportunity," he added. Bobby further said that such charges "obviously" bothered him.

349.title: Will Smith's 'Emancipation' to be delayed due to Oscars slap incident: Report
349.article_body: Actor Will Smith's upcoming film 'Emancipation' is reportedly being delayed following his Oscars slap incident. According to Variety, Apple is planning to postpone the film's release to 2023. Notably, several of Will's projects are on hold after the actor slapped comedian Chris Rock onstage after the latter made a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith's medical condition.

350.title: Bars, restaurants serving liquor in Gurugram allowed to remain open 24x7
350.article_body: As part of the Haryana government's new liquor licensing policy, bars and restaurants serving liquor in Gurugram will have the option to remain open 24x7. The new rules aim to counter Delhi's excise policy, under which bars and restaurants serving liquor can remain open till 3 am. The establishments can start serving liquor from 8 am from June onwards.

351.title: Lake next to landfill turns pink due to cyanobacteria in Chennai
351.article_body: A lake, next to a landfill, in Chennai's Perungudi in Tamil Nadu, has turned pink. The phenomenon is due to the presence of cyanobacteria, a professor at the National Institute of Technical Teachers' Training and Research said. "This is an algal bloom...here we don't have any industries...the colour of the water turned pink because of the leachate," the professor added.

352.title: Man gets life term for killing 18-year-old in Rajasthan in 2014
352.article_body: A special court in Rajasthan's Bundi sentenced a 30-year-old man to life imprisonment for murdering an 18-year-old woman in 2014. During the investigation, it was found that the convict had lured the woman, taken her away and allegedly raped her before strangling her to death. He had dumped her body in a well, which was recovered nine days later.

353.title: Greater Noida Authority to invoke Gangster Act against offenders
