353.article_body: The Greater Noida Authority will invoke Gangster Act against builders or individuals found involved in land encroachment. The decision was taken at a meeting chaired by newly appointed Greater Noida Authority CEO Surendra Singh. Officials have been asked to draw up a list of land mafias and individual work circle officers have been asked to submit lists of illegal constructions.

354.title: 'KGF: Chapter 2' crosses ₹400 crore in Hindi, second film to do so
354.article_body: The Hindi version of 'KGF: Chapter 2' has become the second film to cross the ₹400 crore mark, only behind 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'. The Hindi version of SS Rajamouli's film had earned ₹511 crore. 'KGF: Chapter 2' had previously surpassed the lifetime business of the film 'Dangal' to become the second-highest grossing film in Hindi ever.

355.title: Avinash Sable becomes fastest Indian to run 5,000 metres, breaks 30-year-old record
355.article_body: Runner Avinash Sable has become the fastest Indian to run 5,000 metres. The 27-year-old achieved the feat by clocking 13:25.65 at the Sound Running Track Meet in the US. He broke the national record set by Bahadur Prasad, who had clocked 13:29.70 in June 1992 at Barcelona Olympics. Sable finished 12th at the meet in San Juan Capistrano.

356.title: Bled through my pants, couldn't get a tampon during meeting: TikTok ex-employee
356.article_body: A former employee at TikTok claimed that she bled through her pants instead of leaving a meeting to get a tampon amid the high-pressure work culture at the company. In a recent report, former employees have cited 85 hours of meetings a week, lack of sleep and mental anguish as some of the things they faced at the company.

357.title: Mumbai man refusing to vacate flat for redevelopment to pay ₹5 lakh to housing society
357.article_body: The Bombay HC imposed ₹5 lakh on a Mumbai housing society's member, who wasn't vacating his flat, which is in a dilapidated building, so a developer could demolish it and construct a new one in its place. The HC directed him to vacate the flat within two weeks, failing which, the court receiver would take forcible possession of the house.

358.title: 2 men call gathering of Muslims in Karnataka 'small Pakistan'; held
358.article_body: Two men were arrested after they allegedly called a gathering of people in Nanjangud in Karnataka's Mysuru "chhota (small) Pakistan" in a video. According to the police, the video of the incident shows Muslim men standing on the road after offering prayers and shouting slogans. The incident reportedly took place on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr on May 3.

359.title: Survey of Gyanvapi mosque complex near Kashi Vishwanath temple begins in UP
359.article_body: The court-ordered survey of Gyanvapi mosque complex next to Kashi Vishwanath temple in UP has begun. The survey was ordered on a plea by five women to gain yearlong access to prayers at a Hindu shrine in the Gyanvapi-Kashi Vishwanath complex. Prayers are currently only allowed once a year at the shrine. Protests were reported from the site on Friday.

360.title: Video captures massive explosion at 5-star hotel in Havana
360.article_body: A video of a massive explosion at a five-star hotel that claimed at least 22 lives in the Cuban capital of Havana has surfaced online. The video showed plumes of dust and smoke rising from the building. Cuban President Miguel Díaz-Canel has said that the explosion at Hotel Saratoga appears to have been caused by a gas leak.

361.title: Ukraine conflict taking heavy toll on Russia’s most capable units: UK
361.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said the Ukraine conflict is taking a "heavy toll on some of Russia's most capable units and most advanced capabilities". The ministry added that it would "take considerable time and expense for Russia to reconstitute its armed forces" following the conflict and would be "particularly challenging to replace modernised and advanced equipment" due to Western sanctions.

362.title: Buttler can break Kohli's record of highest runs in IPL season: Harbhajan
362.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said RR opener Jos Buttler can break Virat Kohli's record for scoring highest runs in an IPL season, adding that he "will" break it if RR reach the IPL 2022 final. "It's very difficult to stop him," stated Harbhajan. Kohli had set the record by aggregating 973 runs for RCB in IPL 2016.

363.title: Punjab Police arrested me like a terrorist: Tajinder Bagga
363.article_body: BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga has alleged that the Punjab Police arrested him on Friday as "they do it with a terrorist". "I was not shown any warrant...I told them to let me tie my turban. They did not give me the chance to wear the turban and slippers...Nearly 50 policemen came (in)," Bagga said.

364.title: Pune court orders wildlife offenders to build waterholes in forests
364.article_body: A court in Pune has directed two people accused of wildlife offences to build two waterholes each for wild animals in separate cases. The Deputy Conservators of Forest of Pune and Junnar divisions welcomed the step calling it a "unique" and an "environment-friendly" punishment, respectively. According to forest authorities, the court also imposed ₹10,000 fine on one of the offenders.

365.title: BJP should ask who offered CM's post to Yatnal for ₹2,500 cr: DK Shivakumar
365.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Saturday urged BJP to ask party MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal about those who offered him CM's post for money. "Why do they need proof when there's everything available with...Yatnal?" Shivakumar said. This comes after the BJP MLA claimed that "some people from Delhi" had offered him CM's role in exchange for ₹2,500 crore.

366.title: B'luru Customs seize ₹50 lakh-gold hidden in underwear; 1 arrested
366.article_body: Bengaluru Customs tweeted on Friday that a passenger who was allegedly attempting to smuggle gold in paste form, worth over ₹50 lakh, by concealing it in underwear has been arrested. It said that the passenger was intercepted based on intel from the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence. The gold weighed 966.1 gm and further investigations are underway, it added.

367.title: Hope world would sanction China if it invades Taiwan: Foreign Min
367.article_body: Taiwanese Foreign Minister Joseph Wu said Taiwan hopes that the international community will sanction China like it's sanctioning Russia for the Ukraine war, if Beijing invades it. Taiwan has joined in Western-led sanctions on Russia and its ally Belarus over the Ukraine invasion. The move is largely symbolic given the island's minimal levels of direct trade with Belarus or Russia.

368.title: Body of missing law student found in Patiala's Bhakra canal
368.article_body: The body of a woman from Kolkata, studying in LLB final year at Rajiv Gandhi National University of Law in Patiala, was recovered from Bhakra canal on Friday, police said. The woman had gone missing along with her batchmate on May 2. Police said there's no clue about the 23-year-old man, adding they are investigating the case from all angles.

369.title: Associates of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi arrested in Gurugram
369.article_body: The Gurugram Police arrested three people in two separate raids suspected to be associates of gangsters Lawrence Bishnoi and Goldy Brar. Three country-made pistols and ammunition were recovered by the police in the first raid at the Mubarikpur crossing, police said. However, in the second raid in Manesar, two pistols and 20 live cartridges were recovered from the two suspects.

370.title: HDFC hikes home loan rates by 30 bps after RBI's repo rate hike
370.article_body: HDFC on Saturday raised its Retail Prime Lending Rate (RPLR) on home loans by 30 basis points, which will be effective from May 9. Earlier, the lender had increased its benchmark lending rate by 5 basis points. Notably, the Reserve Bank of India hiked the repo rate by 40 basis points earlier this week.

371.title: Brazil's Vale signs long-term deal to supply Tesla with nickel
371.article_body: Brazilian miner Vale SA has signed a long-term deal with Tesla to supply the EV maker with nickel from its Canadian operations. The agreement involves supplying Tesla with low-carbon Class 1 nickel. Vale said it aims for between 30% and 40% of its Class 1 nickel sales to go to the EV sector.

372.title: When I got opportunities to play Tests after Ganguly's retirement, I got cancer: Yuvraj
372.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh, in a recent interview, said he wanted to play 100 Tests for India. "When I got opportunities to play Tests after Dada's (Sourav Ganguly) retirement...I got diagnosed with cancer," he added. He stated, "It has just been bad luck. I tried 24x7. I wanted to play 100 Tests...I gave it everything...but it wasn't meant to be."

373.title: Arsenal offered new contract the day we lost 3 consecutive matches: Arteta
373.article_body: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta who has signed a contract extension until 2025, said the club offered him the new contract on the day when they lost three consecutive matches. "The club was so decisive and committed," added Arteta. Arsenal lost three consecutive matches in April after being defeated by Crystal Palace, Brighton and Southampton in Premier League matches.

374.title: 7 of a family die in car crash on Yamuna Expressway in UP; PM expresses condolences
374.article_body: At least seven members of a family were killed and two were injured when a car collided with another vehicle on Yamuna Expressway in UP's Mathura on Saturday. "Among those killed, three are women, three men...one child died on the spot," police said. "My deepest condolences to those who lost their loved ones in this accident," PM Narendra Modi tweeted.

375.title: Woman beaten by estranged husband's lawyer at MP court as baby seen lying on ground
375.article_body: A woman was beaten by her estranged husband's lawyer at a court in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district, with the video of the incident showing her baby lying on ground. The lawyer can be seen chasing the woman and punching her in the back. Local police told PTI that the incident took place on Thursday, and they have booked the lawyer.

376.title: Anupam shares pics with Rajamouli, says 'Was wonderful to talk about our epics'
376.article_body: Veteran actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram on Friday to share a series of pictures from his meeting with filmmaker SS Rajamouli at Goafest. "What an awesome man! Wonderful to talk to him about joint families, childhood stories, our epics and of course about life in cinema," he captioned the pictures with the hashtags 'RRR' and 'The Kashmir Files'.

377.title: Liquor likely to get cheaper in Gurugram as Haryana govt cuts taxes
377.article_body: The prices of imported foreign liquor (IFL) in Gurugram are likely to decrease from June as the Haryana government has reduced the excise duty and value-added tax (VAT) on the sale of liquor. The state government's new excise policy will come into effect from June 12. The policy will also allow more liquor vends in a single zone.

378.title: Bengaluru Police busts cricket betting racket, seize ₹4 lakh
378.article_body: Bengaluru Central Crime Branch (CCB) busted a cricket betting racket on Friday and arrested a person in Halasuru PS limits for illegal betting during IPL T-20 match. The accused was allegedly betting on a cricket match between Gujarat Titans and Mumbai Indians. The police seized cash worth ₹4 lakh and a mobile phone from the arrested person.

379.title: American billionaire Boehly-led group to buy Chelsea in £4.25-bn deal from Abramovich
379.article_body: Chelsea have agreed terms on the £4.25-billion sale of the club to a consortium led by American billionaire Todd Boehly, who is a co-owner of the LA Dodgers baseball team. The club was put up for sale before owner Roman Abramovich was sanctioned for his alleged links to Russian President Vladimir Putin following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

380.title: Musk, Twitter sued by Florida pension fund to delay $44 bn deal
380.article_body: Elon Musk and Twitter were sued by a Florida pension fund seeking to stop Musk from completing his $44 billion buyout before 2025. The fund cited a Delaware law under which shareholders who own over 15% of a company can't enter a merger without two-thirds of remaining shares granting approval. Musk is effective "owner" of over 15% of Twitter shares.

381.title: Obesity may weaken vaccine protection: Study
381.article_body: Obesity may weaken vaccine protection against COVID-19 in people, who have never been infected with the coronavirus, a study has found. Researchers compared the effect of vaccination on people without previous SARS-CoV-2 infection, who received the Pfizer vaccine, and found that patients with severe obesity had over three times lower antibody levels than normal-weight individuals.

382.title: Farhan to debut in Marvel Cinematic Universe with 'Ms Marvel': Report
382.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar will reportedly make his debut in the Marvel Cinematic Universe with 'Ms Marvel', an upcoming series which will also feature Iman Vellani and Pakistani actor Fawad Khan. According to Deadline, Farhan will make a guest appearance in the series. 'Ms Marvel' will feature Iman as Kamala Khan, who's a Muslim American teenager growing up in Jersey City.

383.title: Game was in their favour, will take with both hands: Rohit on MI beating GT
383.article_body: Discussing MI's win against GT by five runs, MI captain Rohit Sharma said, "Things were in their favour...We will take this with both hands." "We were 15-20 runs short," added Rohit. "I felt they like pace coming on to the bat, so we wanted to take that off," stated Rohit. It was MI's second consecutive win in IPL 2022.

384.title: It was my gift: Ronaldinho on Lionel Messi's first goal for Barcelona
384.article_body: Talking about seven-time Ballon d'Or winner Lionel Messi's first goal for former club Barcelona, Brazilian legend Ronaldinho who assisted the goal tweeted, "How easy it is to play with this beast! First goal was my gift." Ronaldinho chipped the ball over two defenders in the match played on May 1, 2005 with Messi converting with a chip as well.

385.title: ED staff threatened top executives with physical violence during probe: Xiaomi
385.article_body: Xiaomi alleged that its top executives faced threats of "physical violence" during questioning by Enforcement Directorate. It said that its India MD Manu Kumar Jain, current Financial Officer Sameer and their families were warned by ED officials of "dire consequences" if they didn’t submit the statements needed by them. ED had seized Xiaomi's ₹5,551 crore assets over forex violations recently.

386.title: Every death scientifically registered: K'taka Health Min on WHO COVID data
386.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar accused the World Health Organization (WHO) of exaggerating the number of deaths due to COVID-19 in India without any scientific evidence and rational reasoning. "We stick to our own numbers...Every death in this country has been scientifically registered," he said. "Every death is registered in the most fragmented way in India," he added.

387.title: Ex-US policeman jailed over violent arrest of woman with dementia
387.article_body: An ex-US police officer was sentenced to five years in prison for assaulting a 73-year-old woman with dementia and later joking about it with colleagues. Karen Garner was left with a broken arm, sprained wrist and a shoulder injury during the 2020 arrest by officer Austin Hopp. Garner was arrested for forgetting to pay about $14 for items at Walmart.

388.title: Policeman suffers serious injuries in terrorist firing in Srinagar
388.article_body: A policeman suffered serious injuries after terrorists opened fire at him in J&K's Srinagar on Saturday morning. He was reportedly riding a bike when he was attacked at the Aiwa Bridge. According to officials, the policeman is deployed with the emergency flying squad. He is critical and has been moved to a hospital for treatment, officials added.

389.title: Man booked as 2-month-old son dies after he threw him on floor in Punjab
389.article_body: A man was booked by Punjab's Ludhiana police on Friday following the death of his two-month-old son after he allegedly threw the baby on the floor on suspicion that the baby was a result of his wife's extra-marital affair. The wife claimed that the accused was unemployed and addicted to drugs and had done so following an argument between them.

390.title: JNU council approves 70% licence fee waiver for shops inside campus
390.article_body: Jawaharlal Nehru University's (JNU) Executive Council (EC) on Friday approved a 70% licence fee waiver for shops inside the campus. "The council approved the waiver of 70% of licence fee to all the shops allotted by JNU which were closed during 2020 and 2021 on account of lockdown due to the spread of COVID-19," the Registrar said.

391.title: Punjab man dies while saving daughter after son-in-law hits her
391.article_body: A 58-year-old man has died after he allegedly tried to save his daughter who was being hit by her husband after she refused his demand of a scooter as dowry in Punjab's Ludhiana. The daughter claimed that when her father intervened, her "inebriated" husband pushed the latter, who then fell unconscious. The daughter also claimed her husband assaulted her "regularly".

392.title: Actor Mohan Juneja, who featured in 'KGF', passes away aged 54
392.article_body: Actor and comedian Mohan Juneja, who featured in both parts of 'KGF', passed away aged 54 on Saturday at a private hospital in Bengaluru. Juneja, who hailed from Karnataka's Tumakuru district, was suffering from a prolonged illness. He worked in over 100 movies in Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Hindi languages.

393.title: Ukrainian father seen showing his 15-yr-old dead son's blood to captured Russian soldier
393.article_body: A picture of a Ukrainian man showing his 15-year-old dead son's blood to a captured Russian soldier has surfaced on social media. The boy died of his injuries after a shelling raid in Kharkiv. The boy was with his parents and other workers helping to evacuate animals from a zoo when a shell landed nearby.

394.title: Govt may privatise one of its 3 general insurers after LIC IPO launch: Report
394.article_body: After the launch of LIC's IPO, the Centre may privatise one of its general insurance companies this year, said a report. It detailed that by the time LIC is listed on stock exchanges, the government will start work to identify one of its three general insurers, namely, National Insurance Co., United India Insurance Co. and Oriental India Insurance for privatisation.

395.title: China to ban minors from tipping livestreamers & watching after 10 pm
395.article_body: China has ordered internet platforms to stop underage users from tipping livestreamers or becoming livestreamers themselves without guardian consent. The platforms will also need to strengthen the management of peak hours for such shows and shows will need to be "forcibly" turned off by 10 pm local time for users of their parental control "youth mode" functions.

396.title: Tamil Nadu CM takes bus ride, speaks to people about 1 yr of governance
396.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM and DMK leader MK Stalin on Saturday took a ride on a Municipal Transport Corporation bus in Chennai as his government completed one year of governance. "He spoke with passengers and the conductor on one year of his governance," ANI reported. "He inquired about the benefits of the free bus fare to women," the CM's office tweeted.

397.title: Army major falls off cliff during anti-terror operation in J&K's Uri; dies
397.article_body: Indian Army Major Raghunath Ahlawat, 34, reportedly died after falling off a steep cliff during a counter-infiltration operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Uri on Thursday. He was leading the operation near the Line of Control in Baramulla when he slipped due to bad weather and fell in a 60-metre-deep ravine. He died on the way to the hospital, officials said.

398.title: BJP just bothered about what Punjab and Maha Police are doing: Raut
398.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut criticised BJP government and said that inflation is the "biggest issue" in the country but neither PM nor FM or BJP leaders are speaking on it. "They are just bothered about what police in Punjab and Maharashtra are doing," he added. People gave befitting reply to those who tried to spoil situation in Maharashtra, Raut said.

399.title: Maharashtra govt is scared of Raj Thackeray: Cong's Sanjay Nirupam
399.article_body: Congress leader Sanjay Nirupam has claimed that the Maharashtra state government is scared of MNS chief Raj Thackeray and therefore, not taking any action against him. "The Maharashtra Police had set 16 conditions for the rally in Aurangabad, out of which he (Raj) has violated 12...I don't understand why is the Mumbai Police not doing anything?" Nirupam asked.

400.title: Gang claiming to have magical powers to multiply money held in Hyderabad
400.article_body: Hyderabad's Meerpet police on Friday busted a woman-led gang for cheating people by claiming to have magical powers that could multiply money. The six-member gang was apprehended after a man from Hasthinapuram complained of being duped of ₹11 lakh by the accused. According to police, main accused, Sulthana, is a habitual offender who had been arrested earlier in similar offences.
